title: Pipeline Data Analyst, Argentina
description: Pipeline Data Analyst - ArgentinaDo you enjoy being part of a successful team?Are you looking for new opportunities?Join our team!The PPS business delivers pipeline and process services to the oil and gas market globally. In-line Inspection and Integrity Engineering are services that provide inspection and pipeline integrity reports for our customers globally. Delivering accurate and reliable data and analysis is the cornerstone of the PPS business and is integral in ensuring the safe operating of oil and gas pipelines.Partner with the bestAs a Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the production of accurate and reliable inspection reports, which are integral to the safe operation of oil and gas pipelines. The Pipeline Data Analyst role is responsible for the interpretation of inspection data and the production of pipeline inspection reports delivered to clients across the globe.As a Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:Achieving of industry certifications allowing for full-scale data analysis.Knowing of data preparation and processing.Integrating of any supplementary data.Applicating of client profiles to organize and report In Line Inspection results. Identifying quality or productivity issues and potential solutions.Reporting cycle time Fuel your passionTo be successful in this role you will:Have a Bachelor's Degree in science, technology, engineering and/or mathematics (STEM) content or Technical school degree.Have an upper-intermediate/advanced English level.Demonstrate to have detailed, analytical, process orientated approach with ability to drive issues to a robust closure in a timely manner.Demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Excel. This is not a data science role.As part of our commitment to the health and safety of our employees, customers and the communities in which we operate, this role requires full vaccination for COVID-19 prior to beginning work. Requests for reasonable accommodations due to valid medical reasons, a sincerely held religious belief, or other personal conscience objection will be considered on a case-by-case basis, including but not limited to essential job duties, in accordance with applicable law.Work in a way that works for youWe recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:Working with usOur people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.Working for youOur inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activitiesComprehensive private medical care optionsSafety net of life insurance and disability programsTailored financial programsAdditional elected or voluntary benefits About UsWith operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.Join UsAre you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!.About Us:With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.Join Us:Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.R70962

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: About UsPacifica Continentalis an international recruitment consultancy that provides different services focused on talents to impact companies’ business all over the world. We provide a young and dynamic environment and by being result-oriented our main goal it's to delivery outstanding solutions for all of our clients.Our customized solutions and consultative approach ensure we select the best talent in the market and our operations have reached over 50 countries, including more than 250 cities around the world.We pride ourselves on working with precision and expertise in a wide range of industries!Our DNAAmbition - We are guided by excellence, we push for progress and not perfection.Connection - We believe that people are the real drive of our company.Global Mindset - We value diversity and believe that we are enriched by it.Ownership - We take responsibility for our actions.At Pacifica, you will have plenty of opportunity to grow and assist in the development of others. We connect well-being and professional development.Take a Look Into Your Future at Pacifica ContinentalAsa Business Intelligence Analyst,you will have a key role in developing our data-driven mindset and supporting diverse business-related strategies as well as help in the data architecture of the company and develop new automations/dashboards to give business scalability to the company.Develop analytical dashboards in Power BI to sales and operational areas.Develop automations to gain business scalability such as review internal procedures and lookout for procedures that can be automatized with VBA, Python, Power automate or any other tool.Extraction, transform and Load routines, develop our OLAP environment and data warehouse.Develop Queries and lookout on the OLTP environment.Look for inside company trends and insights to help Management team adding value to the business strategy andgrowth with analytics dashboards.Create reports to monitor business effectiveness and capture the evolution of the business looking out our internal databases.Contribute to the organizational strategicplanning once you shall be a focus point of data-driven information.Lead Sales Calls with offices worldwide providing Commercial inputs and be a focal point for LATAM Operational teams analyzing sales databases.Requirements:Soft skills or educational requirements:Ending or having a bachelor’s degree (Bachelors in Technology, engineering or Business Administration are preferred);Fluent English is amust have;Business orientedmindset;Ability to workindependently, with ownership of thearea and orienting other members of the area;Motivation to work in a multiculturalenvironment;Ability to handle confidentialinformation;Good communication skills;Hard Skills & Knowledge:Must have on tools: Excel and Power BIknowledge – Intermediate/advanced level; Power Query – Intermediate; SQL Server Management Studio – Intermediate; Pentaho or other similar ETL/Orchestration tool – Basic/Intermediate; Must have on languages: T-SQL – Intermediate level; Python – Basic/Intermediate level; DAX – Intermediate level; M – Basic/Intermediate levelMust have on concepts: Data Warehouse, OLAP X OLTP, Relational databases, ETL, Scrum/Agile, Kinds of relationship, Storytelling, DataViz…Not mandatory but is a plus: Azure SQL Relational databases; Azure Virtual Machines; Azure Web Apps Power Apps, Power automate; SharePoint; Postman; API RequestsWhat we offer:CompetitiveSalary;Performance bonus;Meal Voucher;Sportclub;Health and Dental Insurance - OSDE 310;Meritocraticculture and multicultural environment;Notebook and mobile – other tools for home office may be provided on demand;Hybrid work model.

Ajustes trimestrales. Evaluación anual de desempeño y revisión de categorización. BAU LUNCH: Recibirás un cupón de Pedidos Ya cada viernes del mes. BAU INTERNET: Reintegro mensual parcial de tu factura. BAU ANTI-TRAFFIC: En caso de que tu contratación sea en modalidad Híbrida, tendrás opción de elegir tu rango de horario laboral mientras lo avale el proyecto. BAU UTLITIES: ¡Luego de trabajar 4 años con la misma notebook en Baufest, será tuya! BAU FAMILY: Maternidad y Paternidad. Softlanding para las madres baufesianas y Paternidad (10 días hábiles de licencia) . Flexibilidad horaria planificada; BAU HEALTH: Medicina prepaga de primer nivel para grupo familiar; Reintegro trimestrales por actividad deportiva, clases de yoga y Bienestar. BAU DAYs: Día de cumpleaños Libre BAU ACADEMY: Clases de Inglés in-company; Certificaciones y capacitaciones a cargo de Baufest; Pro Profes (días extra de estudios, premios para estudiantes Universitarios/Terciarios/Posgrados); BAU HOME: Luego de 2 años en Baufest, si tienes que cambiar tu residencia y mudarte recibirás una orden de compra para acompañarte en este gran paso. Excelente Clima Laboral ¡Estamos dentro de Ranking Great Place to Work!

title: Data Analyst - Associate - Rosario
description: Line of ServiceTaxIndustry/SectorNot ApplicableSpecialismTransfer PricingManagement LevelAssociateJob Description & SummaryA career in our STEM line of Service, within Technology Strategy services, will provide you with the opportunity to help organisationsdevelop strategies that transform their technology capabilities and solve their most critical challenges. We focus on building technology enabled and agile operating models, planning their new enterprise architecture into a differentiating capability system that helps them win in the market, leveraging digital analytics to enhance the customer experience and optimising business operations, and using modern management techniques such as roboticprocess automation and next generation sourcing strategies to help our clients get fit for growth.To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.As an Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:Invite and give in the moment feedback in a constructive manner.Share and collaborate effectively with others.Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise.Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.Follow risk management and compliance procedures.Keep up-to-date with developments in area of specialism.Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in the materials I produce.Build and maintain an internal and external network.Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms.Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.As a Junior Consultant in DATS, you are an important member of the team supporting transaction-focused projects. In this role, you will work on data analytics assignments that span across the entire lifecycle of an M&A deal. You will support sell- and buy-side due diligence activities by preparing common data models, visualizations, automation and machine learning models. You will take ownership of tasks and work streams of international client-related projects.EssentialBachelor’s degree (or advanced) in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics or related fields.Solid knowledge of data models and/or process modelling.High degree of analytical thinking and ability to solve complex problems.Willingness to take ownership for tasks.Strong communication skills in Spanish and English, verbal and written.You can share your concepts with clarity, get to the core of issues and contribute to our success as a true team player.Ability to work independently on qualitative and quantitative analyses.Show self-learning abilities.Team player who can engage in international teams.Advanced English level, both verbal and written.High intermediate skills in MS-Office tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).DesirableExperience in workflow tools such as AlteryxExperience in visualization tools such as: Tableau, PowerBI or similar.Experience in programming languages such as: SQL, Python or similar.Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)Degrees/Field of Study required:Degrees/Field of Study preferred:Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)Required SkillsData Analysis, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft SQL ServerOptional SkillsDesired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)EnglishTravel RequirementsNot SpecifiedAvailable for Work Visa Sponsorship?NoGovernment Clearance Required?NoJob Posting End DateFebruary 28, 2023

title: Customer Insights Analyst
description: PedidosYa es la empresa de tecnología líder en delivery y quick commerce presente en 15 países de América Latina. Nuestro objetivo es brindar experiencias únicas a nuestros usuarios a través de nuestra pasión por la tecnología. Somos parte de Delivery Hero, compañía alemana líder mundial en quick commerce.¡Somos un equipo inquieto de más de 4000 personas y siempre vamos por más! Estamos siempre buscando personas con ganas de crear en cada momento, apasionadas por lo que hacen, y sobre todo, que quieran jugar en equipo. ¿Te quieres sumar?Tenemos una oportunidad para vos, estamos buscando un/una Customer Insights Analyst para sumarse a nuestro equipo regional de CX, con base en Argentina.¿Qué desafíos te esperan? Analizar, dar seguimiento y ser dueño de las principales métricas de experiencia del usuario.Identificación de oportunidades basadas en el análisis de datos.Análisis y reingeniería de procesos para lograr brindar una buena experiencia a los usuarios.Generar informes y dashboards que permitan la identificación de insights y el seguimiento de la evolución de los KPIs.Ser referente respecto de los KPIs de experiencia con otras áreas y equipos, locales o regionales.Construcción de estrategias para alcanzar objetivos relacionados con la mejora en la operación.¿Qué tendrás que aportar?Experiencia mínima de 1 año en puestos que requieran análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos (Excluyente)Estudiantes avanzadas/os y/o graduadas/os en carreras de Ingeniería, Ciencias Económicas y/o afines. (Excluyente)Buen manejo de Excel (Excluyente)Conocimientos sobre herramientas de análisis y generación de reportes (SQL, Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc) (No excluyente)¿Qué podés esperar de PedidosYa?Aprender en un ambiente dinámico, donde puedes explorar tu potencial y tus ideas al máximo. Trabajar junto con un equipo listo para jugar, dispuesto a compartir conocimiento, experiencias y desafíos.Tener la capacidad de generar impacto y crear en cada momento. Creamos una nueva industria y la reinventamos cada día. Una empresa en pleno crecimiento, con mucho contacto internacional en Latam y todo el mundo.Un lugar donde puedas ser quien eres y disfrutar lo que haces todos los días.Flexibilidad y autonomía para definir junto con tu equipo la mejor manera de trabajar.

title: Data Analyst
description: If you are passionate about data, and you clearly visualize the business story and enjoy crafting intelligence reports that drive today's successful businesses, then we want to speak with you!The Level Access Accessibility Product Team places an emphasis on meaningful experiences that result in a phenomenal work environment that fosters success for all our employees.Traits And ExperiencesYou are a mix of data analyst, business analyst, analytics translator, visual presenter, and data artist, who is equally at home discussing business use cases with project owners and talking shop with the product and development team. You're deeply driven about accelerating growth through data-driven decision support across all our business functions.Through a combination of outstanding analytical and storytelling skills you'll help us better understand the value we deliver to our customers and partners, and drive key decisions that will craft the future of LAWe are a software company that is driven toward digital inclusion and accessibility for people with disabilities. Your role as a data analyst, will impact positively, enabling a better digital environment for all.Objectives And ResponsibilitiesPartnerPartner with product management and engineering to understand product instrumentation needs for insights and analyticsPartner with our outstanding product team and senior leadership, to understand their objectives and build data product experiences. Offering practical insights, that illuminate and accurately steer product direction, roadmaps, documentation efforts, training content, growth goals and retention strategiesPartner with product management and engineering to understand product instrumentation needs for insights and analyticsBuildProduce insights (e.g., performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioural personas) to accelerate adoption and business growth, and illuminate product strategyBuild, deploy, and/or maintain data management systems and back-end data infrastructure for our business intelligence pipelineBuild data visualisations; reports, dashboards, and data auditsDesign and build scalable data models to optimise internal and customer experiencesDesign and build a dashboard / real-time reports to gauge and monitor rapid growth patterns. Design and drive to deliver a process and data strategy for ongoing product usage analyticsDesign and implement repeatable frameworks to measure the impact of releases and experiments. This will include upcoming releases, product leadership decision support by providing periodical data driven visualization. Develop a framework for data maintenance for business reporting. Communicate, design / build a reporting repository to be consumed and used on a periodic basis by the Product teamTake full advantage of off-the-shelf as well as in-house technologies to build a best-in-class data management and presentation pipelineInfluenceInfluence and promote solid foundational data practices through demonstrated expertise and excellent knowledge with transfer management, through mentorship and applying your Domain Expertise, to all Product team membersBring intelligence to customer data through the power of: structured data (workflow state evolution, database tables), unstructured data (utterances, descriptions, documents, etc.) adapting to their outstanding, often sophisticated configurations and working at scale. Ability to see the story behind the data and work with product managers to craft effective narratives about our value that we're creating for our customers with our productsPassionate about automating data analysis, business intelligence and a drive to grow beyond BI as we grow into a significantly data driven future together.

Esos reportes deben permitir entender la información de forma rápida y fácil, proporcionando una visión estándar, medible y unificada del proyecto.Detectar nuevas oportunidades y/o mejoras de negocio basadas en datos.Detectar y proponer nuevas metodologías, herramientas y modelos que promuevan la innovación en Ciencia de Datos.Asistir al negocio frente a problemáticas que requieran soluciones basadas en datos.Son RequisitosEstudiante de Administración de Empresas, Sistemas de Información, Marketing o afín.Excel AvanzadoConocimientos de herramientas BI (Microstrategy, BusinessObjects BI, Power BI, etc.)Experiencia en la gestión de altos volúmenes de datos.Resolución, autogestión y análisis serán competencias valoradas en el perfil seleccionado
location: Moreno, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina

title: Global Data Analyst
description: Join us and celebrate the beauty of human experience. Create for happier, healthier lives, with love for nature. Together, with kindness and humility, we deliver food innovations, craft inspired fragrances and develop beauty and wellbeing solutions that make people look and feel good. There’s much to learn and many to learn from, with more than 16,800 employees around the world to explore ideas and ambitions with. Dive into varied, flexible, and stimulating environments. Meet empowered professionals to partner with, befriend, and stretch your skills alongside. Every day, your energy, your creativity, and your determination will shape our future, making a positive difference on billions of people. Every essence of you enriches our world. We are Givaudan. Human by nature.Givaudan is a global leading company in taste and wellbeing, fragrance, and beauty. With its heritage stretching back over 250 years, the company has a long history of innovating scents and tastes. From a favorite drink to your daily meal, from prestige perfumes to cosmetics and laundry care, its creations inspire emotions and delight millions of consumers the world over. The company is committed to driving purpose-led. long-term growth while leading the way to improve happiness and health for people and nature. In the fiscal year 2020, the Company employed over 15,800 people worldwide and achieved sales of CHF 6,3 billion and a free cash flow of 12,8% of sales. Let's imagine together on www.givaudan.comThe Global Data Analyst, who is part of the Global Analytics team, is extracting, analyzing, and mass-loading master data in our core systems. He/she is supporting various projects with analysis, extractions, and data migration activities.You will:Advanced Analytics  Data analysis of large data sets using state-oft he-art methods and tools to identify business rules and continuous improvement opportunities Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of large data sets used for analysis Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner Enhancing data collection procedures to include informationETL (Extraction, Transformation, Load) Drive data mapping activities to support Migration projects and/or Acquisition projects Handling of service requests, execution of reports, and mass uploads Set up mass uploads, reports, and measurements for repetitive execution while ensuring the highest level of data integrity at the global levelProject Management Work alone comfortably Contribute to end MD Projects & Change Requests Actively participate in projects, including continuous improvements, design, data migration/ requirements/processes Support MD Champions with all kinds of analysis and process implementations Perform root-cause analysis, data quality analysis, impact analysis, measurements, and feasibility studies Review of data service requests from businesses to clarify and ensure global consistencyPeople and collaboration Provide professional support for Junior colleagues Act as the contact person for key internal and external stakeholders for operational topics Builds constructive and effective relationships with cross-functional teams and stakeholders Communicate effectively with internal and external partners by phone or via emailYou are:You have a college or university degreeYou are fluent in EnglishYou have 1+ years of relevant experience in a function-specific role or equivalent. You have a good working knowledge of SAP or other ERP systemsYou have advanced MS Excel knowledge and good knowledge of Microsoft Office or equivalent toolStrong numeracy and administration skillsOur Benefits:Flexible work arrangements (possibility to work from home 4 times/week)Competitive benefits packageLong-term career development opportunitiesIn case you are interested, please apply with your English CV.Givaudan is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V.At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people's lives. You work within an inspiring team culture – where you can thrive, collaborate and learn from other talented and passionate people across disciplines, regions, and divisions. Join us and Impact Your World!Diversity drives innovation and creates closer connections with our employees, customers, and partners. Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world.At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people’s lives.You work within an inspiring teamwork culture – where you can thrive, collaborate and learn from other talented and passionate people across disciplines, regions and divisions.Every essence of you enriches our world.Diversity drives innovation and creates closer connections with our employees, customers and partners.Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world.

title: Clinical Data Analyst
description: At #Cognizant, we have an ideal opportunity for you to be part of one of the largest companies in the digital industry worldwide.Ranked as Top Employers and as a Great Place to Work for millennials, we offer potential associates opportunities to be part of a very fast-moving company with an innovative entrepreneurial mindset and excellent growth trajectory. We also promote an inclusive culture where we value different perspectives.We are currently looking for professionals to work in our Clinical Data Management Team. What do we value?People with initiative and responsibility, who have good diction and excellent treatment with the client. We will assess those who have a technical profile or related experience in the role. Necessary skills and experience required:A Graduate/Post Graduate/Doctorate degree in Life sciences/ Pharmacy/Medical sciences or equivalent degreeMinimum 2 years to 6 years of experience in clinical data managementProactively communicate ownership of studiesCritical thinking to identify root causes and best solutions for data discrepancy managementConfidence to have tough conversations and make challenging decisionsEnables an environment of open and honest communication and critical thinking within DSS study teamInfluence internal team to meet timelines by holding stakeholders accountableAbility to work with different personalities to get the work doneWillingness to seek out information to accomplish goalProactive communicationResponsibility: As a Data Analyst, you’ll work on a project, with responsibility for: Perform Migrations / Set up / Close out activities apart from Study Conduct activities under supervision and quality checksTriage of Safety casesOversight of data discrepancy managementOwner of study documentation, including completeness, accuracy, and performing periodic review of eTMF/TMFResponsible for compiling HoS contentConduct the protocol amendment impact assessment and complete appropriate documentationManage migration and audit trail reportsCreate slides for study-specific EDC investigator trainingGenerate all study related reports, status updates, and carries out all study related email conversation and communication with internal stakeholders and Client.Provide study specific training to data manager (DM)Contribute to the Data Management Plan (DMP)Request DTS creation and ensure DTS finalized and complete for any LSH loadsExecute data review per IDRP (e.g. SAE reconciliation, PK reconciliation, short term-long term reconciliation)Manage table in EDC for study specific inclusion/exclusion data (SDTM related to protocol)Manage global and study-specific data entry conventionsFacilitate versioning, including Unlock/audit trail review & Archival processKnowledgeable of study protocol to provide secondary feedback to SD/DWA for consistency and completeness of clinical database/study designTimely communication with key stakeholders on issues and risks, includingBrings CDR, DWA, and SD together to discuss post-production changes when identifiedProvide critical information to PL who will communicate with study teamLog any action issues into DS Hub and resolve outstanding issues assigned to DAMange assigned activities to meet milestone datesAsk questions to get information needed to meet end goalsManage programming only changes (Move to DWA for LSH and SD for EDC when SOP and T11/12 updated)Location: Buenos Aires, Argentina. Shift: Full Time. (9 am to 6 pm)We offer OSDE for you and your primary family group, a very competitive salary, an annual bonus, and unlimited access to Udemy. There are many other benefits that we are going to share during the selection process.  Join our team!!

title: Data Analyst - Associate - Rosario
description: Line of ServiceTaxIndustry/SectorNot ApplicableSpecialismTransfer PricingManagement LevelAssociateJob Description & SummaryA career in our STEM line of Service, within Technology Strategy services, will provide you with the opportunity to help organisationsdevelop strategies that transform their technology capabilities and solve their most critical challenges. We focus on building technology enabled and agile operating models, planning their new enterprise architecture into a differentiating capability system that helps them win in the market, leveraging digital analytics to enhance the customer experience and optimising business operations, and using modern management techniques such as roboticprocess automation and next generation sourcing strategies to help our clients get fit for growth.To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.As an Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:Invite and give in the moment feedback in a constructive manner.Share and collaborate effectively with others.Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise.Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.Follow risk management and compliance procedures.Keep up-to-date with developments in area of specialism.Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in the materials I produce.Build and maintain an internal and external network.Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms.Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.As a Junior Consultant in DATS, you are an important member of the team supporting transaction-focused projects. In this role, you will work on data analytics assignments that span across the entire lifecycle of an M&A deal. You will support sell- and buy-side due diligence activities by preparing common data models, visualizations, automation and machine learning models. You will take ownership of tasks and work streams of international client-related projects.EssentialBachelor’s degree (or advanced) in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics or related fields.Solid knowledge of data models and/or process modelling.High degree of analytical thinking and ability to solve complex problems.Willingness to take ownership for tasks.Strong communication skills in Spanish and English, verbal and written.You can share your concepts with clarity, get to the core of issues and contribute to our success as a true team player.Ability to work independently on qualitative and quantitative analyses.Show self-learning abilities.Team player who can engage in international teams.Advanced English level, both verbal and written.High intermediate skills in MS-Office tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).DesirableExperience in workflow tools such as AlteryxExperience in visualization tools such as: Tableau, PowerBI or similar.Experience in programming languages such as: SQL, Python or similar.Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)Degrees/Field of Study required:Degrees/Field of Study preferred:Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)Required SkillsData Analysis, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft SQL ServerOptional SkillsDesired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)EnglishTravel RequirementsNot SpecifiedAvailable for Work Visa Sponsorship?NoGovernment Clearance Required?NoJob Posting End DateFebruary 28, 2023

title: Pipeline Data Analyst (Digital Solutions) - Buenos Aires, Argentina
description: Do you enjoy being part of a successful team?Are you looking for new opportunities?Join our team!The PPS business delivers pipeline and process services to the oil and gas market globally. In-line Inspection and Integrity Engineering are services that provide inspection and pipeline integrity reports for our customers globally. Delivering accurate and reliable data and analysis is the cornerstone of the PPS business and is integral in ensuring the safe operating of oil and gas pipelines.Partner with the bestAs a Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the production of accurate and reliable inspection reports, which are integral to the safe operation of oil and gas pipelines. The Pipeline Data Analyst role is responsible for the interpretation of inspection data and the production of pipeline inspection reports delivered to clients across the globe.As a Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:Achieving of industry certifications allowing for full-scale data analysis.Knowing of data preparation and processing.Integrating of any supplementary data.Applicating of client profiles to organize and report In Line Inspection results. Identifying quality or productivity issues and potential solutions.Reporting cycle timeFuel your passionTo be successful in this role you will:Have a Bachelor's Degree in science, technology, engineering and/or mathematics (STEM) content.Have an upper-intermediate/advanced English level.Demonstrate to have detailed, analytical, process orientated approach with ability to drive issues to a robust closure in a timely manner.Demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Excel.This is not a Data science role.Work in a way that works for youWe recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:This role is an office based working pattern in Buenos AiresWorking with usOur people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.Working for youOur inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activitiesComprehensive private medical care optionsSafety net of life insurance and disability programsTailored financial programsAdditional elected or voluntary benefitsAbout UsWith operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.Join UsAre you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!.About Us:With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.Join Us:Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.R50375

title: Data Analyst Sr - Science
description: Job DescriptionEn Cervecería y Maltería Quilmes nos encontramos en la búsqueda de personas dinámicas que buscan desafíos constantes y sueñen en grande.Su rol principal será la exploración de datos provenientes de la aplicación B2B (BEES) de Cervecería Quilmes y la realización de análisis descriptivos, para brindar a las áreas de negocio información e insights que agreguen valor en la toma de decisiones.Responsibilities and assignmentsDescubrimiento de preguntas de negocio a resolver con análisis, testeos y modelos, identificando las necesidades de los usuarios y contribuyendo a construir un producto de datos que resuelva las mismas.Exploración de los conjuntos de datos disponibles y/o nuevas fuentes de datos, para resolver esas problemáticas.Ejecución de análisis basados en estadística descriptiva o modelos de ciencia de datos, para detectar oportunidades y patrones en los datos.Brindarle al negocio insights a partir de los datos y modelos creados.Coordinación con el negocio para la adopción de la solución brindada y el monitoreo del valor agregado.Aprender de los equipos del negocio, de la experiencia con la aplicación y con la operación de ventas, para encontrar las oportunidades de mejora y ejecutar iniciativas que mejor cubran esa necesidad.Requirements And QualificationsUniversitario completo o próximo para finalizar. Preferentemente con especialización en obtención y modelado de datos.Experiencia en posiciones similares, manejando grandes volúmenes de datos y analizándolos con técnicas estadísticas.Analítico / Orientado a resultados / Resolutivo / Organizado / Liderazgo de equipos y pares.ExcluyentesCompetencias Técnicas:Conocimiento y experiencia con lenguaje SQL, para la extracción y modelado de datos.Experiencia en manejo de datos con Python o R.ExcelHabilidades de comunicación y presentación.No ExcluyentesHerramientas de visualización (preferentemente, Power BI)Conocimientos Agile.¡Te damos la bienvenida! Somos Cervecería y Maltería QuilmesEn Argentina contamos con más de 6.000 colaboradores, que trabajamos en 10 cervecerías y plantas de elaboración de gaseosas, 2 malterías, 1 chacra de lúpulo, 1 planta de insumos, 11 centros de distribución, 9 oficinas de venta directa y una red de más de 173 distribuidores independientes.Formamos parte de Anheuser-Busch InBev, la Compañía cervecera líder en el mundo, que se conformó a través de diversas fusiones, en los últimos años, con distintas empresas como Ambev, Interbrew, Anhauser Bush, Grupo Modelo, SAB Miller, entre otras.Nuestra gente sueña en grande. Somos apasionados por lo que hacemos, y nuestro mayor objetivo es innovar en el sector de bebidas con la mayor calidad y variedad para que nuestros consumidores nos elijan y tengan la mejor experiencia de consumo.¡Nuestra cultura está enfocada en construir un ambiente inclusivo y colaborativo, en el que las personas puedan sacar lo mejor de sí mismas! Queremos seguir sumando personas comprometidas, que quieran cambiar las cosas, les guste innovar y los desafíos, y siempre vayan por más. Por eso, buscamos talentos diversos, dispuestos a construir nuestro gran propósito: Soñamos en grande para crear un futuro con mas motivos para brindar.¡Conocé nuestras búsquedas, y postulate!¡Te estamos buscando a vos!

title: Data Analyst
description: JLL Supports The Whole You, Personally And Professionally.Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.We are currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of DATA ANALYST to join our team:Location: Microcentro, Capital Federal, Buenos Aires. Work schedule: Monday to Friday, 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. Contract Type: Open-ended / Indefinite-term. About the position: We are looking for a Data Analyst – Data Management & Delivery who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Data Management team.This role requires partnering with the broader JLL team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data analysis and data management experienceResponsibilities:Independently develops, executes and monitors complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects. Develops proficiency in multiple data management disciplines and tools to develop robust data and information management solutions. Proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures. Monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives. Ensures proper escalation, prioritization and remediation of data quality issues. Engages with colleagues and internal customers to reverse xisting business processes and identify core business requirements for new information deliverables and data infrastructure. Consults with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of JLL data. Identifies and acquires new data sources, performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships, and develops prototype solutions to deliver immediate business value. This position involves updating the bases and global systems of all information and invoice processing. Collects and manages the necessary information to carry out the control panel: KPILeads the assembly of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) of the costumer, reconciling historical and projected information. Requirements:3 years of work experience in the fields of Information Science, data management and/or computer science or Economics. Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in Science, Business, or Social Science. Advanced degree preferred. Must have strong SQL skills. Knowledge of ETL and statistical tools such as Informatica, SSIS and other data science tools such as Python, R, Tableau are desirableExperience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or business intelligence deployed in a complex environment. Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyse data to develop actionable business information deliverables. Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently. Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast paced environment. Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages. Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing. Excellent technical, analytical and organizational skills. Benefits:Health Insurance for you. Annual Performance Bonus. Online platform with certified courses for professional development. Discounts in several categories (Gym, academic institutions, among others). Location: Hybrid –Buenos Aires, ARGIf this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet all the requirements. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!About JLL –We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.JLL Privacy NoticeJones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement.For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.For candidates in the United States, please see a full copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here.Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may contact us at Accommodation Requests. This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

title: Analista de datos - Mix (On Site & Remoto) (1236)
description: ¿Qué hace la compañía?Importante Grupo Bancario, que se ubica entre las 10 principales entidades del Sistema Financiero Argentino con más de 180 sucursales en todo el país. Son agentes financieros de sus respectivas provincias y líderes en depósitos y préstamos del sector privado, ofrecen productos y servicios financieros a individuos y empresas a través de múltiples canales digitales y de su amplia red de sucursales.¿Qué necesitás para ser parte del equipo?A Nivel PersonalQue cuentes con capacidad de organización y planificación de la información.Que sepas trabajar en equipo.Que seas analítico/a.Que puedas manejar grandes volúmenes de datos.A Nivel TécnicoExperiencia de 2 años o más en funciones a fines.Experiencia como Analista de datos.Experiencia con SQL y Apache Hive.¿Qué vas a hacer?Como Analista de datos, tendrás a tu cargo las siguientes responsabilidades:Relevamiento de datos y generación de documentación.Extracción, procesamiento y agrupación de datos: análisis de los mismos.Modelación de la información: datos estructurados y no estructurados.Creación de modelo final para los usuarios.Gestión de demandas con el PO y realización de informes.¿Con quién trabajarás?Serás parte del importante sector de Área de Gobierno de Datos corporativo y le darás servicio a las distintas gerencias.¿Cuándo y dónde trabajarás?Trabajarás en un esquema mixto, con algunos días de presencialidad y el resto con beneficio de Home Office. Las oficinas se encuentran en Microcentro, CABA. La franja de trabajo de referencia es de 8 horas, de lunes a viernes, de 9 a 18 hs.¿Qué ofrecen?Relación de dependencia directa.Home Office.Prepaga para grupo familiar.Adicional por el Día del Bancario.Bonificación en seguros de vida, hogar, bolso protegido, robo en cajero y en auto.Capacitaciones.Gimnasio.Kit de bienvenida.Presentes por fechas especiales.¿De qué fases consta el proceso de selección?Tendrás una primera entrevista con nuestra Recruiter, Katherine Dopta, para conocer tus experiencias laborales e intereses.Luego, tendrás el primer acercamiento con el cliente, en una entrevista con el área de RRHH propia. Y por último, una instancia técnica y gerencial.

title: Data Analyst Sr - Science
description: Job DescriptionEn Cervecería y Maltería Quilmes nos encontramos en la búsqueda de personas dinámicas que buscan desafíos constantes y sueñen en grande.Su rol principal será la exploración de datos provenientes de la aplicación B2B (BEES) de Cervecería Quilmes y la realización de análisis descriptivos, para brindar a las áreas de negocio información e insights que agreguen valor en la toma de decisiones.Responsibilities and assignmentsDescubrimiento de preguntas de negocio a resolver con análisis, testeos y modelos, identificando las necesidades de los usuarios y contribuyendo a construir un producto de datos que resuelva las mismas.Exploración de los conjuntos de datos disponibles y/o nuevas fuentes de datos, para resolver esas problemáticas.Ejecución de análisis basados en estadística descriptiva o modelos de ciencia de datos, para detectar oportunidades y patrones en los datos.Brindarle al negocio insights a partir de los datos y modelos creados.Coordinación con el negocio para la adopción de la solución brindada y el monitoreo del valor agregado.Aprender de los equipos del negocio, de la experiencia con la aplicación y con la operación de ventas, para encontrar las oportunidades de mejora y ejecutar iniciativas que mejor cubran esa necesidad.Requirements And QualificationsUniversitario completo o próximo para finalizar. Preferentemente con especialización en obtención y modelado de datos.Experiencia en posiciones similares, manejando grandes volúmenes de datos y analizándolos con técnicas estadísticas.Analítico / Orientado a resultados / Resolutivo / Organizado / Liderazgo de equipos y pares.ExcluyentesCompetencias Técnicas:Conocimiento y experiencia con lenguaje SQL, para la extracción y modelado de datos.Experiencia en manejo de datos con Python o R.ExcelHabilidades de comunicación y presentación.No ExcluyentesHerramientas de visualización (preferentemente, Power BI)Conocimientos Agile.¡Te damos la bienvenida! Somos Cervecería y Maltería QuilmesEn Argentina contamos con más de 6.000 colaboradores, que trabajamos en 10 cervecerías y plantas de elaboración de gaseosas, 2 malterías, 1 chacra de lúpulo, 1 planta de insumos, 11 centros de distribución, 9 oficinas de venta directa y una red de más de 173 distribuidores independientes.Formamos parte de Anheuser-Busch InBev, la Compañía cervecera líder en el mundo, que se conformó a través de diversas fusiones, en los últimos años, con distintas empresas como Ambev, Interbrew, Anhauser Bush, Grupo Modelo, SAB Miller, entre otras.Nuestra gente sueña en grande. Somos apasionados por lo que hacemos, y nuestro mayor objetivo es innovar en el sector de bebidas con la mayor calidad y variedad para que nuestros consumidores nos elijan y tengan la mejor experiencia de consumo.¡Nuestra cultura está enfocada en construir un ambiente inclusivo y colaborativo, en el que las personas puedan sacar lo mejor de sí mismas! Queremos seguir sumando personas comprometidas, que quieran cambiar las cosas, les guste innovar y los desafíos, y siempre vayan por más. Por eso, buscamos talentos diversos, dispuestos a construir nuestro gran propósito: Soñamos en grande para crear un futuro con mas motivos para brindar.¡Conocé nuestras búsquedas, y postulate!¡Te estamos buscando a vos!

title: Pipeline Data Analyst, Argentina
description: Pipeline Data Analyst - ArgentinaDo you enjoy being part of a successful team?Are you looking for new opportunities?Join our team!The PPS business delivers pipeline and process services to the oil and gas market globally. In-line Inspection and Integrity Engineering are services that provide inspection and pipeline integrity reports for our customers globally. Delivering accurate and reliable data and analysis is the cornerstone of the PPS business and is integral in ensuring the safe operating of oil and gas pipelines.Partner with the bestAs a Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the production of accurate and reliable inspection reports, which are integral to the safe operation of oil and gas pipelines. The Pipeline Data Analyst role is responsible for the interpretation of inspection data and the production of pipeline inspection reports delivered to clients across the globe.As a Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:Achieving of industry certifications allowing for full-scale data analysis.Knowing of data preparation and processing.Integrating of any supplementary data.Applicating of client profiles to organize and report In Line Inspection results. Identifying quality or productivity issues and potential solutions.Reporting cycle time Fuel your passionTo be successful in this role you will:Have a Bachelor's Degree in science, technology, engineering and/or mathematics (STEM) content or Technical school degree.Have an upper-intermediate/advanced English level.Demonstrate to have detailed, analytical, process orientated approach with ability to drive issues to a robust closure in a timely manner.Demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Excel. This is not a data science role.As part of our commitment to the health and safety of our employees, customers and the communities in which we operate, this role requires full vaccination for COVID-19 prior to beginning work. Requests for reasonable accommodations due to valid medical reasons, a sincerely held religious belief, or other personal conscience objection will be considered on a case-by-case basis, including but not limited to essential job duties, in accordance with applicable law.Work in a way that works for youWe recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:Working with usOur people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.Working for youOur inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. In the fiscal year 2020, the Company employed over 15,800 people worldwide and achieved sales of CHF 6,3 billion and a free cash flow of 12,8% of sales. He/she is supporting various projects with analysis, extractions, and data migration activities.You will:Advanced Analytics  Data analysis of large data sets using state-oft he-art methods and tools to identify business rules and continuous improvement opportunities Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of large data sets used for analysis Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner Enhancing data collection procedures to include informationETL (Extraction, Transformation, Load) Drive data mapping activities to support Migration projects and/or Acquisition projects Handling of service requests, execution of reports, and mass uploads Set up mass uploads, reports, and measurements for repetitive execution while ensuring the highest level of data integrity at the global levelProject Management Work alone comfortably Contribute to end MD Projects & Change Requests Actively participate in projects, including continuous improvements, design, data migration/ requirements/processes Support MD Champions with all kinds of analysis and process implementations Perform root-cause analysis, data quality analysis, impact analysis, measurements, and feasibility studies Review of data service requests from businesses to clarify and ensure global consistencyPeople and collaboration Provide professional support for Junior colleagues Act as the contact person for key internal and external stakeholders for operational topics Builds constructive and effective relationships with cross-functional teams and stakeholders Communicate effectively with internal and external partners by phone or via emailYou are:You have a college or university degreeYou are fluent in EnglishYou have 1+ years of relevant experience in a function-specific role or equivalent. You have a good working knowledge of SAP or other ERP systemsYou have advanced MS Excel knowledge and good knowledge of Microsoft Office or equivalent toolStrong numeracy and administration skillsOur Benefits:Flexible work arrangements (possibility to work from home 4 times/week)Competitive benefits packageLong-term career development opportunitiesIn case you are interested, please apply with your English CV.Givaudan is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V.At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people's lives. title: Data Analyst
description: JLL Supports The Whole You, Personally And Professionally.Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.We are currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of DATA ANALYST to join our team:Location: Microcentro, Capital Federal, Buenos Aires. Work schedule: Monday to Friday, 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. Contract Type: Open-ended / Indefinite-term. About the position: We are looking for a Data Analyst – Data Management & Delivery who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Data Management team.This role requires partnering with the broader JLL team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data analysis and data management experienceResponsibilities:Independently develops, executes and monitors complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects. Develops proficiency in multiple data management disciplines and tools to develop robust data and information management solutions. Proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures. Monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives. Ensures proper escalation, prioritization and remediation of data quality issues. Engages with colleagues and internal customers to reverse xisting business processes and identify core business requirements for new information deliverables and data infrastructure. Consults with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of JLL data. Identifies and acquires new data sources, performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships, and develops prototype solutions to deliver immediate business value. This position involves updating the bases and global systems of all information and invoice processing. Collects and manages the necessary information to carry out the control panel: KPILeads the assembly of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) of the costumer, reconciling historical and projected information. Requirements:3 years of work experience in the fields of Information Science, data management and/or computer science or Economics. Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in Science, Business, or Social Science. Advanced degree preferred. Must have strong SQL skills. Knowledge of ETL and statistical tools such as Informatica, SSIS and other data science tools such as Python, R, Tableau are desirableExperience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or business intelligence deployed in a complex environment. Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyse data to develop actionable business information deliverables. Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently. Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast paced environment. Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages. Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing. Excellent technical, analytical and organizational skills. Benefits:Health Insurance for you. Annual Performance Bonus. Online platform with certified courses for professional development. Discounts in several categories (Gym, academic institutions, among others). Location: Hybrid –Buenos Aires, ARGIf this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet all the requirements. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!About JLL –We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. title: Data Analyst Sr - Science
description: Job DescriptionEn Cervecería y Maltería Quilmes nos encontramos en la búsqueda de personas dinámicas que buscan desafíos constantes y sueñen en grande.Su rol principal será la exploración de datos provenientes de la aplicación B2B (BEES) de Cervecería Quilmes y la realización de análisis descriptivos, para brindar a las áreas de negocio información e insights que agreguen valor en la toma de decisiones.Responsibilities and assignmentsDescubrimiento de preguntas de negocio a resolver con análisis, testeos y modelos, identificando las necesidades de los usuarios y contribuyendo a construir un producto de datos que resuelva las mismas.Exploración de los conjuntos de datos disponibles y/o nuevas fuentes de datos, para resolver esas problemáticas.Ejecución de análisis basados en estadística descriptiva o modelos de ciencia de datos, para detectar oportunidades y patrones en los datos.Brindarle al negocio insights a partir de los datos y modelos creados.Coordinación con el negocio para la adopción de la solución brindada y el monitoreo del valor agregado.Aprender de los equipos del negocio, de la experiencia con la aplicación y con la operación de ventas, para encontrar las oportunidades de mejora y ejecutar iniciativas que mejor cubran esa necesidad.Requirements And QualificationsUniversitario completo o próximo para finalizar. Preferentemente con especialización en obtención y modelado de datos.Experiencia en posiciones similares, manejando grandes volúmenes de datos y analizándolos con técnicas estadísticas.Analítico / Orientado a resultados / Resolutivo / Organizado / Liderazgo de equipos y pares.ExcluyentesCompetencias Técnicas:Conocimiento y experiencia con lenguaje SQL, para la extracción y modelado de datos.Experiencia en manejo de datos con Python o R.ExcelHabilidades de comunicación y presentación.No ExcluyentesHerramientas de visualización (preferentemente, Power BI)Conocimientos Agile.¡Te damos la bienvenida! Somos Cervecería y Maltería QuilmesEn Argentina contamos con más de 6.000 colaboradores, que trabajamos en 10 cervecerías y plantas de elaboración de gaseosas, 2 malterías, 1 chacra de lúpulo, 1 planta de insumos, 11 centros de distribución, 9 oficinas de venta directa y una red de más de 173 distribuidores independientes.Formamos parte de Anheuser-Busch InBev, la Compañía cervecera líder en el mundo, que se conformó a través de diversas fusiones, en los últimos años, con distintas empresas como Ambev, Interbrew, Anhauser Bush, Grupo Modelo, SAB Miller, entre otras.Nuestra gente sueña en grande. Somos apasionados por lo que hacemos, y nuestro mayor objetivo es innovar en el sector de bebidas con la mayor calidad y variedad para que nuestros consumidores nos elijan y tengan la mejor experiencia de consumo.¡Nuestra cultura está enfocada en construir un ambiente inclusivo y colaborativo, en el que las personas puedan sacar lo mejor de sí mismas! Queremos seguir sumando personas comprometidas, que quieran cambiar las cosas, les guste innovar y los desafíos, y siempre vayan por más. Por eso, buscamos talentos diversos, dispuestos a construir nuestro gran propósito: Soñamos en grande para crear un futuro con mas motivos para brindar.¡Conocé nuestras búsquedas, y postulate!¡Te estamos buscando a vos!

title: Pipeline Data Analyst, Argentina
description: Pipeline Data Analyst - ArgentinaDo you enjoy being part of a successful team?Are you looking for new opportunities?Join our team!The PPS business delivers pipeline and process services to the oil and gas market globally. In-line Inspection and Integrity Engineering are services that provide inspection and pipeline integrity reports for our customers globally. Delivering accurate and reliable data and analysis is the cornerstone of the PPS business and is integral in ensuring the safe operating of oil and gas pipelines.Partner with the bestAs a Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the production of accurate and reliable inspection reports, which are integral to the safe operation of oil and gas pipelines. The Pipeline Data Analyst role is responsible for the interpretation of inspection data and the production of pipeline inspection reports delivered to clients across the globe.As a Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:Achieving of industry certifications allowing for full-scale data analysis.Knowing of data preparation and processing.Integrating of any supplementary data.Applicating of client profiles to organize and report In Line Inspection results. Identifying quality or productivity issues and potential solutions.Reporting cycle time Fuel your passionTo be successful in this role you will:Have a Bachelor's Degree in science, technology, engineering and/or mathematics (STEM) content or Technical school degree.Have an upper-intermediate/advanced English level.Demonstrate to have detailed, analytical, process orientated approach with ability to drive issues to a robust closure in a timely manner.Demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Excel. This is not a data science role.As part of our commitment to the health and safety of our employees, customers and the communities in which we operate, this role requires full vaccination for COVID-19 prior to beginning work. Requests for reasonable accommodations due to valid medical reasons, a sincerely held religious belief, or other personal conscience objection will be considered on a case-by-case basis, including but not limited to essential job duties, in accordance with applicable law.Work in a way that works for youWe recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:Working with usOur people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.Working for youOur inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activitiesComprehensive private medical care optionsSafety net of life insurance and disability programsTailored financial programsAdditional elected or voluntary benefits About UsWith operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.Join UsAre you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!.About Us:With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. title: Ssr Engineer (Contractor)
description: TrovaTrip is a travel planning and booking platform for content creators. We’re a team of trail blazers–and not just because we are based in Portland, OR. We take a crawl, walk, sprint approach to everything we do and bring along the best talent to make it all happen. Our mission is to make travel easier, safer and more accessible to all. From backpacking to Patagonia to practicing yoga on the beaches of Bali – we make it possible with 150 unique experiences in 48 countries.When it comes to lighting the way, our team works together with full openness and transparency including our dedication to diversity and inclusion throughout our customer-base and employees. We value empathy, questioning the process and thinking sideways to build the leading platform in group travel.Ultimately, we care about getting it right and delivering the best possible experience for our community of travel buffs. If you are looking to develop your career and thrive off a fast-paced, collaborative culture where you can make an impact, see our open job positions with the TrovaTrip team.About this position:We are looking for an experienced JavaScript and/or TypeScript Engineer who is passionate about building products that customers love. Our platform connects travelers, hosts and tour operators into a unique marketplace for travel - and our users can’t get enough. We are expanding our team in the US to provide the next set of features and products to provide an even better experience to our customers.Essential Functions:Build back-end and front-end services and APIs to drive existing and new features for web and mobile apps.Collaborate with Product to create clear technical specifications and deliverables.Own features and products from specification phase through to delivery.Contribute to roadmap development and represent engineering in planning discussions.Become a technical expert, coach and leader of a software domain.Qualifications:3+ years of software development experience as a full stack engineer shipping to production.Passion for learning, working with others, and making everyone on the team better.Excellent knowledge of ES6+ JavasScript and/or Typescript, HTML, CSS.Experience in some of these technologies: React/ReactNative, Node.js, MongoDB, Memcached, Heroku, Continuous Integration, Automation Frameworks.Products:Marketplace web application connecting travelers, hosts, and international tour operators.Digital assets supporting hosts to market and sell trips to prospective travelers online.UI component library to let us build flexible and beautiful user interfaces.Mobile applications to connect travelers and hosts more closely to each other and to their destinations.Benefits:Direct contractor mode with Trovatrip Inc. - Payment 100% in USDConvenient Stock optionsOpportunities grow your career along with the companyMulticultural and Flex Work EnvironmentTrovaTrip is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. TrovaTrip considers equal opportunity, diversity, and inclusion to be fundamental to the mission of the company.

title: IBM Planning Analytics - Developer
description: Who is Recruiting from Scratch: Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients. Our Client We're a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment. Team background: The Planning Analytics (PA) team serves a variety of operating groups. We develop and maintain sophisticated financial models for allocations/recoveries/forecasting/invoicing/journal posting. The Team is spread across Sydney, Gurugram, Houston, Jacksonville and Manila and provide round the clock support to business as they work on PA/TM1 models. Responsibility: The candidate is expected to develop bespoke PA applications, models, integrations, and interfaces according to business requirements. Enhance and suggest improvements to existing models. Work directly with Business Owners and Users. Skills: Technical Deep understanding of all aspects of TM1 and Planning Analytics.  In-depth knowledge of multidimensionality, hierarchies, cubes design, Turbo Integrator processes, writing Rules and Feeders, developing Active Forms & TM1 Websheets, structured PAW templates, etc  Knowledge of PA and PAW security and user authentication principles.  Worked on at least 2 large scale E2E implementation of PA based projects preferably in the Banking or Financial Services industry.  Knowledge of integrating PA with Data warehouses, SQL, and Data Management principles.  Knowledge of PA administration, environment (CPU, RAM, Diskspace) management, and object deployment across DEV, UAT, DR, PROD.  Experience working with PA Local hosted on a cloud platform and/or PA on IBM SaaS  Experience in REST API, Python, Powershell, VBA, Power BI, Alteryx will be advantageous  Technical documentation skills, and experience using applications like Confluence  Experience using project tracking applications like JIRA. Functional Understanding of SCRUM methodology and experience working in an Agile environment  Able to conduct requirements workshops, gather requirements, translate into a PA design and develop project roadmaps.  Proactively monitor PA models and liaise with internal clients to ensure client satisfaction.  Promote the understanding of Planning Analytic within the business.  Willing to share knowledge with end users and team members and conduct training sessions  Work with other Tech teams to implement and improve data flows and integrations as well as resolve issues.  Delivering all models as per corporate policies and practices.   Minimum Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree in a Technical field or equivalent.  At least 5+ years of experience in developing TM1/PA applications used by over 100 users.  Experience with technical design process and models.  Experience with Agile SW development processes  Strong verbal and written communication skills Location: Hybrid in Houston TX (2 days a week in office). We offer relocation assistanceBase Salary: $95K - $120k+
