title: Analista Funcional BI - REMOTO (1204)
description: ¿Qué hace la compañía?La empresa cuenta con diferentes unidades de negocios, las cuales integran un complejo agroindustrial con 7 plantas fabriles, más de 40 plantas de acopio en 8 provincias del país y explotaciones agropecuarias. Abastecen tanto al mercado argentino con productos de consumo masivo como también a más de 45 países del mundo.¿Qué buscan?A Nivel PersonalQue pongas el foco en lograr los objetivos y generar impacto en el resto de la empresa.Que puedas generar un buen clima laboral y crecer a nivel profesional junto con el equipo de trabajo.A Nivel TécnicoQue puedas realizar relevamientos de requerimientos técnicos en el cliente interno para el desarrollo de soluciones en Business Intelligence.Que puedas coordinar desarrollos con proveedores externos y con los equipos de tecnología.¿Qué necesitás para ser parte del equipo?Para sumarte a este desafío, será importante que cuentes con todos o al menos, gran parte de estos requerimientos:Experiencia de al menos 3 o 4 años en un rol similar.Experiencia en herramientas de Extracción, Transformación y Carga de Datos (ETL) (Preferencia SQL, SSIS).Análisis de Datos (Preferencia: MicroStrategy) (Otras: Power BI, Tableau, QlikView).Disponibilidad para asistir a la planta 1 vez al mes.Estudios avanzados o culminados en carreras de sistemas o afines.Experiencia en Proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial | No excluyente.Desarrollo en Python | No excluyente.¿Qué vas a hacer?Como Analista Funcional BI, tendrás a tu cargo las siguientes responsabilidades:Relevar las necesidades del cliente interno, diseñar la solución y gestionar el desarrollo de la misma.Relevar las necesidades con usuarios referentes.Diseño de Data Warehouse, Tableros, Reportes.Diseño de procesos ETL.¿Cuándo y dónde trabajarás?Los horarios de trabajo son de 8 a 12 y de 13:15 a 18 teniendo un espacio al mediodía para el almuerzo. En el caso de los días de oficina presencial el horario es de 9 a 18.La búsqueda está abierta a todo el país y la modalidad depende de la localización. Si estás en CABA la propuesta es de 4 días de Home Office y un día de presencialidad.¿Qué ofrecen?Relación de dependencia directa con la empresa.Prepaga para grupo familiar.Trabajo remoto con presencialidad 1 vez a la semana o 1 vez al mes, dependiendo de la localización.Bono anual.Integrarse a equipos de alto desempeño, utilizando tecnología de punta.Capacitación en nuevas tecnologías.Excelentes posibilidades de desarrollo y clima laboral.Trabajar en una empresa sólida y pujante.3 semanas de vacaciones.Becas para estudios de familiares.Beneficios por casamiento/nacimientos.Plan de telefonía móvil.¿De qué fases consta el proceso de selección?Tendrás una primera entrevista con nuestro Recruiter, Carla Carrizo Álvarez, para conocer tus experiencias laborales e intereses.Luego, con la empresa empleadora tendrás una entrevista para conocer al equipo de tecnología y de RRHH. Para finalizar el proceso de selección incluye una instancia de psicotécnico y estudios médicos.

title: Insight Analyst
description: About The PositionThis is a full-time position that consists of the development and communication of research insights to our clients, with the aim of helping them increase the ROI of their marketing campaigns. You will be in charge of supporting clients and informing Memorablel's overall product strategy. In order to develop this role, you will be trained to understand the key factors behind memory and attention.Through effective design and implementation of individual account strategies, we expect the candidate to build long term, sustainable and profitable relationships with the customer. The role requires high-level customer consultation in the marketing industry.ResponsibilitiesCoordinate the link with clients, managing daily requests and anticipating their testing demands to proactively find solutions. Create insights about the cognitive impact of our client's content, leveraging the predictions of our algorithms. This includes building and presenting reports yourself. Inform Memorable's product strategy, including changes to key features in the dashboard and the insights provided to clients. Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships. Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives. Research accounts to identify key players and conduct the sales process. Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement. About YouYou are a semi-senior marketer with experience working in media agencies. You are business-oriented, results-driven, and passionate about understanding consumers' experience with quantitative and/or qualitative research. You constantly aim for excellence and you are motivated to scale up a marketing optimization platform to reach market leadership. You thrive in dynamic environments and take the strong initiative to build an outcomes-maximizing work agenda.‍Minimum QualificationsBachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, Engineering, or a related field. Relevant experience in consumer research, business intelligence, consumer product marketing, marketing management, market research, and /or strategic planning in large companies. Excellent English skills. Experience working directly with ad creative either on design, guidance, or approval of assets. Excellent communication skills and experience presenting research insights to clients. Outstanding organizational skills. Superior time management skills and strong attention to detail. Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, managing deliverables and deadlines. Preferred QualificationsExperience working in a growth-stage startup. Direct experience in enterprise/SAAS sales. Advanced degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or related field. Strong network of established relationships across large brands, agencies and advertisers. Experience in account management. Successful sales experience. Ability to understand client strategies and tactical requirements to clearly articulate the company's offerings to develop solutions that deliver value. Work or research experience in cognitive science, neuroscience, or associated fields. ‍What We OfferCompetitive salary. Work from home with flexible work hours. Unlimited paid time off. Publication opportunities. Science-driven culture. Contacts within the Harvard and MIT ecosystem. Yearly bonus for personal learning.
location: Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina

title: Data Engineer
description: DescriptionSobre TiendanubeSomos la plataforma líder de e-commerce en América Latina que, desde 2010, trabaja con un propósito muy claro: potenciar y motivar las personas empreendedoras que quieran transformar sus sueños en historias que trasciendan. Sí, el desafío es enorme ¡porque nos gusta pensar en grande!Para lograr este objetivo, priorizamos el bienestar de nuestros clientes así como el de todas las personas que forman parte de Tiendanube, desde Argentina, Brasil, Colombia y México.Nuestro equipo es el alma de la empresa y todo lo que logramos, lo hacemos juntos. Tenemos una cultura muy fuerte que cuidamos día a día y en la que valoramos la excelencia, la transparencia, la autonomía, la diversidad y la colaboración.Gracias al compromiso de todo este equipo y a la confianza de nuestros clientes y socios, en 2021 nos convertimos en la 5.ª startup más valiosa de Latinoamérica, alcanzando una valuación de más de 3 mil millones de dólares. Esto nos impulsa a seguir trabajando para reducir al máximo las barreras del emprendedurismo en todo LATAM.Nuestro equipo de Big DataLa misión de nuestro equipo es de empoderar a todos los equipos de Tiendanube en la toma de decisiones a través de datos. Para eso tenemos que hacer crecer nuestra plataforma de datos de manera que sea suficientemente robusta para que cualquier persona pueda acceder a la información que necesita, de la forma más eficiente y eficaz posible.El tamaño de tu desafíoConstruir nuevas soluciones dentro de la plataforma de datos que generen impacto hacia otros equipos de Tiendanube.Colaborar con el crecimiento de la plataforma de datos agregando o mejorando sus diferentes capacidades.Acompañar a los diferentes equipos de Data Science & Analytics en la utilización de la plataforma y dar apoyo a sus necesidades, promoviendo las mejoras prácticas.Tener ownership sobre Backlog de mejora continua de nuestra plataforma de datosPromover el uso de buenas prácticas de implementación, adoptando soluciones que garanticen tanto el buen funcionamiento (estabilidad, eficacia, precisión en los datos) como su performance (velocidad de respuesta, concurrencia).Lo que buscamosFormación universitaria en Ingeniería en Informática, Ciencias de la Computación o similares.Experiencia trabajando en equipos de Ingeniería de datos.Experiencia hands-on en herramientas de Big Data como puede ser, bases de datos MPP o data lakes en storage distribuido.Experiencia con herramientas open source dentro del ecosistema de Big Data como lo pueden ser: Airflow / Delta Lake / Databricks / Spark / Trino)Es un plus: Experiencia en la gestión del desarrollo de sistemas de softwares complejos, escalables y de alto rendimiento que se hayan entregado con éxito.Experiencia en la creación y mantenimiento de arquitecturas de alto volumen de datos.Conocimientos de seguridad de datos.Conocimientos de todo el stack de servicios de AWS orientados a Datos.Portugués, nivel intermedio.Nuestro procesoEn Tiendanube estamos convencidos de que, para crear la mejor plataforma de e-commerce, necesitamos construir equipos de alto impacto. Por eso, invertimos mucho tiempo y atención en nuestro proceso de selección.Luego de que te postules, tu perfil va a ser evaluado por el equipo de Talent Acquisition y te vamos a enviar un feedback, independientemente del resultado de esta etapa.El tiempo y los pasos de nuestro proceso son flexibles según cada área, pero no te preocupes que siempre te vamos a mantener al tanto del estado de tu postulación vía e-mail.Lo que te proponemosActualización trimestral del salario bruto en base a la evolución del dólar CCL (contado con liquidación), a la inflación o a una combinación de ambas variables en partes iguales, según tu preferencia;Ajuste anual por performance;15 días hábiles de vacaciones por año disponibles proporcionalmente desde el primer día de trabajo;Cobertura de salud OSDE 310 para el grupo familiar (cónyuge + hijos);Clases de portugués 100% cubiertas. Además, en caso de que quieras rendirlo, cubrimos la totalidad del costo del examen de Proficiencia (CELPE) del Ministerio de Educación de Brasil;Flexibilidad horaria y posibilidad de trabajo remoto;Licencia familiar extendida a 21 días corridos para personas no gestantes o adoptantes;Una Tiendanube gratuita para vos o alguien de tu entorno;Descuentos en cursos de Coderhouse.Política de PrivacidadTiendanube se compromete a proteger la privacidad y garantizar la seguridad de las personas indicadas para las vacantes que ofrecemos.Para analizar tu solicitud, tendremos acceso a parte de tu información que será revisada antes de continuar. Utilizaremos estos datos para realizar los procesos de reclutamiento y selección. Además, cuidamos muy en serio a nuestras personas y solo compartimos información realmente necesaria. En última instancia, solo los mantendremos en nuestro sistema durante el tiempo que realmente lo necesitemos.Para obtener más información sobre cómo manejamos tus datos, incluidos los de tus derechos según la ley, simplemente accedé a nuestra Política de Privacidad.

title: Data Engineer
description: ioet, Inc is a software company founded in Silicon Valley operating with a mission-driven, multicultural, and talented software development team across LATAM. We use cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative, reliable, and suitable software solutions to clients, from startups to some of the world’s most famous brands.We are looking for a Data Engineer with 3+ years of experience excited about:Leading the delivery of processes to extract, transform and load data from disparate sources into a form that is consumable by analytics processes, for projects with moderate complexity, using strong technical capabilities.Designing, developing and producing data models of relatively high complexity, leveraging a sound understanding of data modelling standards to ensure high quality.Skills needed:Batch Processing - Capability to design an efficient way of processing high volumes of data where a group of transactions is collected over a period of timeData Integration (Sourcing, Storage and Migration) - Capability to design and implement models, capabilities and solutions to manage data within the enterprise (structured and unstructured, data archiving principles, data warehousing, data sourcing, etc.). This includes the data models, storage requirements and migration of data from one system to another.Data Quality, Profiling and Cleansing - Capability to review (profile) a data set to establish its quality against a defined set of parameters and to highlight data where corrective action (cleansing) is required to remediate the data.Stream Systems - Capability to discover, integrate, and ingest all available data from the machines that produce it, as fast as it’s produced, in any format, and at any quality.To qualify for the role, you must have:B.S. in Actuarial, Behaviour Economics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Econometrics, Engineering, IT, Cyber Security, or related field preferred.3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, excellent interpersonal, leadership and English communication skill (written and spoken)Software development skills in Python (intermediate), Apache Airflow, SQL (Redshift), AWS (Redshift, S3 Buckets, MWAA)Attention to detail, strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability. A Self-starter, independent-thinker, curious, customer focused, and creative person with ambition and passion.Excellent time management skills, positive and constructive minded, takes the lead and makes decisions in critical times and tough circumstancesResponsibilities:Leading the production of high-quality data engineering deliverables, helping to ensure project timelines are met, and providing informal mentoring / training to junior members of the team.Leading the delivery of data quality reviews including data cleansing where required to ensure integrity and quality.Leading the delivery of data models, data storage models and data migration to manage data within the organization, for a small to medium-sized project.Resolving escalated design and implementation issues with moderate to high complexity.Analyzing the latest industry trends such as cloud computing and distributed processing and beginning to infer risks and benefits of their use in businessBenefits:Work remotely from Ecuador or any other country in Latam.Flexible schedulePaid in USDPaid HolidaysPaid VacationPaid sick daysPaid family leaveEducational bonusesWork with international clientsFocus on professional growth through a career plan with regular salary revisionsEnglish classes provided by ioet., so that your interaction with our clients becomes more efficient and natural.Working on major projects with international distributed teams where you are part of a multicultural community of expertise.Would you like to join us?Apply Now and build your career with ioet. Send us your resume and cover letter in English. We will be happy to hear about your skills and experience.

description: Buscamos Data Engineer para sumarse a nuestro equipo de Data Analytics de manera remota utilizando Microsoft Cloud.En BI Applications, somos una consultora de datos con más de 16 años de trayectoria en la implementación de soluciones de datos e inteligencia artificial. title: Data Analyst
description: Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de una persona para que se sume como Data Analyst a nuestro equipo de Data de Reba, para que pueda responder preguntas y problemáticas de negocio, realizando modelado de datos y aplicando métodos estadísticos.Entre sus principales funciones se destacan📌 Modelar problemáticas utilizando métodos estadísticos y de machine learning para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer oportunidades de mejora de negocio.📌 Colaborar manteniendo la plataforma de BI para democratizar el acceso a la información.📌 Dar soporte hacia la gerencia y los equipos de producto generando extrayendo información que les permitan tomar decisiones basadas en datos.RequisitosTítulo de grado en carreras de Facultades de Ciencias Exactas, así como Actuario/Economía, Estadística, Sistemas, Ingeniería o afines.Contar con experiencia analizando datos e implementando soluciones aplicando modelos de machine learning. Tener rigurosidad en el mantenimiento y curaduría de datosTener experiencia analizando y visualizando datos en Python y su stack cientïfico (Pandas/Numpy/Scikit-Learn/Jupyter/Matplotlib).Contar con experiencia trabajando con herramientas de control de versión (Git).Poseer conocimientos en bases de datos SQL.Tener experiencia utlizando herramientas de BI.Poseer habilidades de StoryTelling que permitan comunicar los resultados en forma clara y adaptándose a las posibles audiencias.Búsqueda laboral equitativa - Desde Reba sólo te pediremos la información estrictamente necesaria para el desempeño del trabajo que se ofrece. - Ley N°6471BeneficiosContamos con Importantes beneficios corporativos como una semana adicional de licencia, descuentos en gimnasios, clases de inglés in company, descuentos en distintos productos, convenios con prepagas, entre otros.No te olvides de incluir la remuneración bruta pretendida.Garantizamos absoluta confidencialidad y reserva.¡Sumate a Reba!¿Te imaginás siendo parte de la compañía que va a ayudar a miles de personas a vivir la vida que quieren?Reba es la app de servicios financieros que nació con el propósito de incluir a más personas al sistema financiero para que puedan construir el futuro que quieren. A través de una app simple e innovadora, miles de personas pueden tener acceso a los mejores servicios financieros con mayor simplicidad y transparencia.Reba es la App de Reba Compañía Financiera, una entidad Financiera Regulada por el BCRA. Al ser parte de Grupo Transatlántica, la compañía consigue el equilibrio ideal entre el respaldo y trayectoria de más de 50 años de vida en distintas industrias, junto a la innovación y flexibilidad que una compañía joven ofrece al mercado y sus colaboradores.Convencidos de que llegamos más lejos en equipo, buscamos incorporar a aquellos talentos que se sientan motivados por formar parte de un proyecto que va a generar impacto en la vida de miles de latinoamericanos. ¿Qué buscamos en esos talentos? El ADN Rebanker que sean cliente céntricos, que piensen a gran escala, y que trabajen con el más alto estándar de calidad, con respeto y buena onda.Sumate a esta aventura en la que tus ideas no sólo van a llevar tu carrera al próximo nivel, sino que también van a contribuir a cambiar la forma en la que miles de latinoamericanos se relacionan con sus finanzas. ¿Estás listo? ¡Nosotros, re!

title: Data Analyst
description: How we support the Whole You: Our benefits are a good reason to come to JLL.We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry, and then empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their health, financial and personal well-being. Our underlying benefits philosophy is this: be fair to our people and provide opportunities for those who take advantage of our programs and resources to increase their personal and financial security.Benefits to eligible employees, include:Health Insurance for you.Annual Performance Bonus.Online platform with certified courses for professional development.Discounts in several categories (Gym, academic institutions, among others).What this job involves We are looking for a Data Analyst – Data Management & Delivery who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Data Management team.This role requires partnering with the broader JLL team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data analysis and data management experience What is your day to day? Independently develops, executes, and monitors complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects.Develops proficiency in multiple data management disciplines and tools to develop robust data and information management solutions.Proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures.Monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives.Ensures proper escalation, prioritization, and remediation of data quality issues.Engages with colleagues and internal customers to reverse existing business processes and identify core business requirements for new information deliverables and data infrastructure.Consults with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of JLL data.Identifies and acquires new data sources, performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships, and develops prototype solutions to deliver immediate business value.This position involves updating the bases and global systems of all information and invoice processing.Collects and manages the necessary information to carry out the control panel: KPILeads the assembly of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) of the costumer, reconciling historical and projected information. Desired experience and technical skills Required 3 years of work experience in the fields of Information Science, data management and/or computer science or Economics.Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in Science, Business, or Social Science. Advanced degree preferred.Experience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or business intelligence deployed in a complex environment.Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyses data to develop actionable business information deliverables.Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently.Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment.Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages.Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing.Excellent technical, analytical, and organizational skills. Preferred SQL skills. Knowledge of ETL and statistical tools such as Informatica, SSIS and other data science tools such as Python, R, Tableau are desirable Location: Microcentro, Buenos Aires About JLL –We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities. Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do, and we’re honoured to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally. Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued, and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation, and succeed together.

description: GDN AR es una empresa de Retail, con más de 9000 colaboradores a nivel local y 92 tiendas distribuidas en todo el país. Como compañía buscamos ofrecer no solo la mejor calidad de productos al mejor precio, sino también una experiencia cercana y localmente relevante. Desarrollamos relaciones de confianza con nuestros proveedores, ofrecemos las mejores oportunidades de desarrollo para nuestros colaboradores y trabajamos con cada comunidad donde operamos, desde una visión inclusiva y sustentable. Promovemos el desarrollo de un entorno colaborativo que fomente una cultura de innovación, agilidad y respeto por las personas.En esta oportunidad, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Data Analytics para sus oficinas de CABA.El propósito de la posición es transformar las necesidades de nuestros clientes internos a través de medios digitales en aplicaciones simples e intuitivas a nivel de usuario, que permitan mejorar la experiencia de búsqueda, compra y entrega de nuestros clientes.Empoderarse respecto a políticas y normativas de desarrollo, implementando desarrollos iterativos e incrementales.Entender en detalle los sistemas a su cargo y orientar sus desarrollos a la visión de producto y entrega centrada en el cliente.Comprender y desarrollar técnicas que permitan la entrega continua de valor, desarrollo orientado a clientes finales.Responsabilidades:· Liderar el desarrollo y la implementación de reportes comerciales en función a las necesidades del área· Desarrollar tableros de comando para el área comercial segmentado por sus divisiones· Ser el referente técnico para los desarrollos sistémicos del área comercial· Relevar con las áreas clientes el tipo de información que necesitan para la toma de decisiones.· Proveer de herramientas de automatización de la información a las áreas de análisis de costos y planificación comercial.· Dar soporte al proceso presupuestario del área comercialRequisitos: 2 años de experiencia en SQL y Microstrategy, conocimientos básicos de Power BI y Python.En GDN AR buscamos Mejorar la Calidad de Vida de clientes y comunidades creando experiencias relevantes con marcas honestas.Por eso buscamos emprendedores, que les guste asumir desafíos, que sean agiles e impulsen los cambios, que trabajen en redes y que pongan al cliente en el centro en todas sus decisiones.

title: Financial Market Data Analyst
description: Does working for a company that embodies innovation, transparency and creativity excite you? Then, we have the place for you.Bringing together Axioma, DAX and STOXX to form Qontigo represents a partnership beyond standard, creating an investment intelligence advantage with our clients, from risk to return. Qontigo combines the most sophisticated risk analytics and portfolio-construction tools in the market with globally recognized leadership in creating market-defining indices.We Innovate. We Create. We Collaborate.Qontigo is currently seeking a qualified professional to join our Market Data Services team as a full-time employee, based in our Buenos Aires office. In this role, the analyst will produce high quality value-added content, by working closely with the Development, Research, Index, and Client Support business units. The output of the analyst's work will consist of producing a suite of daily-updated multi-factor risk models, quantitative indices, and multi-asset class data analytics. The successful candidate will provide ongoing operational support for best-in-class index products to global sell-side, buy-side, hedge funds, and asset owner investors. The candidate will use quantitative and qualitative skills to manage the ongoing maintenance of index and data products, which include operational processes, data analysis, data reconciliation, and quality assurance.Please submit your resume/CV in English.To note that this position intends to have a monthly late shift rotation covering the Pacific Time (PST) business hours that translates to a Monday-Friday working schedule of 1pm-10pm and 2pm - 11pm Argentina time (dependent on daylight savings time) one week per month. The remaining weeks of the month this position will work regular Argentina business hours. ResponsibilitiesPerform Quality Assurance tasks and data analysis to ensure validity of content produced and delivered to Qontigo's clients, for both the analytics and indexing business lines • Provide ongoing support and maintenance for various index products with time-sensitive deadlines • Monitor financial markets and ensure the correct processing of corporate events, such as IPOs, M&As, stock splits, rights issues, and dividend distributions• Help with data ingestion activities and in data reconciliation tasks about identifiers and other instrument attributes • Work closely with other team members based in the London, Hong Kong, and New York offices of Qontigo • Manipulate large amount of financial data and use various tools to present and analyze results • Assist the Sales and Client Support teams in resolving data inquiries • Proactively look for opportunities to streamline processes wherever appropriate • Collaborate and communicate across all teams involved with index and data production processRequirements• Minimum Bachelor's degree in Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative field • Excellent communication skills and ability to work both independently and with a geographically-dispersed team  • Understanding and interest in Financial Markets and Information Technology • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, detail oriented• Fluent in English (spoken and written) • Financial certifications, including CFA, FRM, and CAIA, are pluses • Experience with SQL, Python or other object-oriented programming language, VBA, UNIX/LINUX very beneficial, but not essential • Experience with financial software (e.g. Bloomberg, Eikon, FactSet) and financial databases are plusesBenefitsCompensation:• Competitive salary• Full benefits package• Performance-based annual bonusQontigo is an equal opportunity employer that offers challenging work in a supportive environment.Direct hires only - no agencies or recruiters
location: Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina

title: Data Analyst
description: Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de una persona para que se sume como Data Analyst a nuestro equipo de Data de Reba, para que pueda responder preguntas y problemáticas de negocio, realizando modelado de datos y aplicando métodos estadísticos.Entre sus principales funciones se destacan📌 Modelar problemáticas utilizando métodos estadísticos y de machine learning para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer oportunidades de mejora de negocio.📌 Colaborar manteniendo la plataforma de BI para democratizar el acceso a la información.📌 Dar soporte hacia la gerencia y los equipos de producto generando extrayendo información que les permitan tomar decisiones basadas en datos.RequisitosTítulo de grado en carreras de Facultades de Ciencias Exactas, así como Actuario/Economía, Estadística, Sistemas, Ingeniería o afines.Contar con experiencia analizando datos e implementando soluciones aplicando modelos de machine learning. Tener rigurosidad en el mantenimiento y curaduría de datosTener experiencia analizando y visualizando datos en Python y su stack cientïfico (Pandas/Numpy/Scikit-Learn/Jupyter/Matplotlib).Contar con experiencia trabajando con herramientas de control de versión (Git).Poseer conocimientos en bases de datos SQL.Tener experiencia utlizando herramientas de BI.Poseer habilidades de StoryTelling que permitan comunicar los resultados en forma clara y adaptándose a las posibles audiencias.Búsqueda laboral equitativa - Desde Reba sólo te pediremos la información estrictamente necesaria para el desempeño del trabajo que se ofrece. - Ley N°6471BeneficiosContamos con Importantes beneficios corporativos como una semana adicional de licencia, descuentos en gimnasios, clases de inglés in company, descuentos en distintos productos, convenios con prepagas, entre otros.No te olvides de incluir la remuneración bruta pretendida.Garantizamos absoluta confidencialidad y reserva.¡Sumate a Reba!¿Te imaginás siendo parte de la compañía que va a ayudar a miles de personas a vivir la vida que quieren?Reba es la app de servicios financieros que nació con el propósito de incluir a más personas al sistema financiero para que puedan construir el futuro que quieren. A través de una app simple e innovadora, miles de personas pueden tener acceso a los mejores servicios financieros con mayor simplicidad y transparencia.Reba es la App de Reba Compañía Financiera, una entidad Financiera Regulada por el BCRA. Al ser parte de Grupo Transatlántica, la compañía consigue el equilibrio ideal entre el respaldo y trayectoria de más de 50 años de vida en distintas industrias, junto a la innovación y flexibilidad que una compañía joven ofrece al mercado y sus colaboradores.Convencidos de que llegamos más lejos en equipo, buscamos incorporar a aquellos talentos que se sientan motivados por formar parte de un proyecto que va a generar impacto en la vida de miles de latinoamericanos. ¿Qué buscamos en esos talentos? El ADN Rebanker que sean cliente céntricos, que piensen a gran escala, y que trabajen con el más alto estándar de calidad, con respeto y buena onda.Sumate a esta aventura en la que tus ideas no sólo van a llevar tu carrera al próximo nivel, sino que también van a contribuir a cambiar la forma en la que miles de latinoamericanos se relacionan con sus finanzas. ¿Estás listo? ¡Nosotros, re!

title: Data Analyst
description: How we support the Whole You: Our benefits are a good reason to come to JLL.We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry, and then empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their health, financial and personal well-being. Our underlying benefits philosophy is this: be fair to our people and provide opportunities for those who take advantage of our programs and resources to increase their personal and financial security.Benefits to eligible employees, include:Health Insurance for you.Annual Performance Bonus.Online platform with certified courses for professional development.Discounts in several categories (Gym, academic institutions, among others).What this job involves We are looking for a Data Analyst – Data Management & Delivery who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Data Management team.This role requires partnering with the broader JLL team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data analysis and data management experience What is your day to day? Independently develops, executes, and monitors complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects.Develops proficiency in multiple data management disciplines and tools to develop robust data and information management solutions.Proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures.Monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives.Ensures proper escalation, prioritization, and remediation of data quality issues.Engages with colleagues and internal customers to reverse existing business processes and identify core business requirements for new information deliverables and data infrastructure.Consults with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of JLL data.Identifies and acquires new data sources, performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships, and develops prototype solutions to deliver immediate business value.This position involves updating the bases and global systems of all information and invoice processing.Collects and manages the necessary information to carry out the control panel: KPILeads the assembly of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) of the costumer, reconciling historical and projected information. Desired experience and technical skills Required 3 years of work experience in the fields of Information Science, data management and/or computer science or Economics.Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in Science, Business, or Social Science. Advanced degree preferred.Experience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or business intelligence deployed in a complex environment.Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyses data to develop actionable business information deliverables.Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently.Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment.Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages.Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing.Excellent technical, analytical, and organizational skills. Preferred SQL skills. Knowledge of ETL and statistical tools such as Informatica, SSIS and other data science tools such as Python, R, Tableau are desirable Location: Microcentro, Buenos Aires About JLL –We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities. Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do, and we’re honoured to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally. Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued, and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation, and succeed together.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: En ICBC seguimos transitando la evolución digital👩‍💻👨‍💻, impulsando y acompañando la transformación!!!, es por eso que nos encantaría que te sumes para ser protagonista de este cambio!💥Seguimos creciendo e innovando y queremos que seas parte!😊 para seguir brindando la mejor experiencia a nuestros clientes y colaboradores, Y vamos por más!🚀En esta oportunidad estamos buscando #BusinessIntelligenceAnalyst para sumarse a nuestro equipo de Data!💪*Objetivo del puesto:Participar en las actividades relacionadas a la implementación de requerimientos empleando determinadas herramientas y tecnologías para la carga, preparación y tratamiento de datos, con el objetivo de proveer soluciones a las áreas usuarias para la toma operacionales y estratégicas.¿Querés ser Business Intelligence en ICBC? Nuestro desafío para vos:Analizar requerimientos e identificar el nivel de complejidad de los desarrollos a realizar, generando las estimaciones correspondientes.Realizar análisis y diseño de los requerimientos, asegurando consistencia con el requerimiento y siguiendo los estándares de documentación definidos.Desarrollar y validar la consistencia de los modelos para la recopilación y el análisis de los datos.Desarrollar funciones mediante el uso de herramientas de extracción, transformación y carga de datos.Crear modelos y planes de prueba, permitiendo su re-utilización en sus distintas fases, además de las pruebas técnicas, funcionales y de performance.Identificar y documentar posibles mejoras a los diseños y modelos desarrollados.Identificar y resolver cuestiones que afectan a su trabajo y al avance de los proyectosColaborar en el desarrollo del enfoque y plan de pruebas de los modelos y funciones, manteniéndolos actualizados.Ayudar a identificar y documentar el impacto y esfuerzo asociado a los requerimientos que representen cambios en los desarrollos realizados.¿Qué necesitamos de vos?Que cuentes con sólida experiencia previa en posición similar.Powercenter programming for Data Warehouse.Shell & PowerShell Scripting.SQL.Teradata.Buscamos personas apasionadas!🧡, con ganas de darlo todo!💪 ganas de crecer, de sumar, de aportar, de animarse, de intentar, de equivocarse, de probar! Queremos aprender de vos y experiencias previas.Que disfrutes de formar parte de equipos colaborativos, con una calidad humana inigualable!Que nos acompañes y seas parte de la transformación de nuestra banca💫, aportando tu perspectiva creativa, innovadora, reforzando la cultura ágil y data driven📈 que estamos construyendo... no tenemos techo!🙌🏻¿Por qué sumarte a #ExperienciaICBC? title: Financial Market Data Analyst
description: Does working for a company that embodies innovation, transparency and creativity excite you? Then, we have the place for you.Bringing together Axioma, DAX and STOXX to form Qontigo represents a partnership beyond standard, creating an investment intelligence advantage with our clients, from risk to return. Qontigo combines the most sophisticated risk analytics and portfolio-construction tools in the market with globally recognized leadership in creating market-defining indices.We Innovate. We Create. We Collaborate.Qontigo is currently seeking a qualified professional to join our Market Data Services team as a full-time employee, based in our Buenos Aires office. In this role, the analyst will produce high quality value-added content, by working closely with the Development, Research, Index, and Client Support business units. The output of the analyst's work will consist of producing a suite of daily-updated multi-factor risk models, quantitative indices, and multi-asset class data analytics. The successful candidate will provide ongoing operational support for best-in-class index products to global sell-side, buy-side, hedge funds, and asset owner investors. The candidate will use quantitative and qualitative skills to manage the ongoing maintenance of index and data products, which include operational processes, data analysis, data reconciliation, and quality assurance.Please submit your resume/CV in English.To note that this position intends to have a monthly late shift rotation covering the Pacific Time (PST) business hours that translates to a Monday-Friday working schedule of 1pm-10pm and 2pm - 11pm Argentina time (dependent on daylight savings time) one week per month. The remaining weeks of the month this position will work regular Argentina business hours. ResponsibilitiesPerform Quality Assurance tasks and data analysis to ensure validity of content produced and delivered to Qontigo's clients, for both the analytics and indexing business lines • Provide ongoing support and maintenance for various index products with time-sensitive deadlines • Monitor financial markets and ensure the correct processing of corporate events, such as IPOs, M&As, stock splits, rights issues, and dividend distributions• Help with data ingestion activities and in data reconciliation tasks about identifiers and other instrument attributes • Work closely with other team members based in the London, Hong Kong, and New York offices of Qontigo • Manipulate large amount of financial data and use various tools to present and analyze results • Assist the Sales and Client Support teams in resolving data inquiries • Proactively look for opportunities to streamline processes wherever appropriate • Collaborate and communicate across all teams involved with index and data production processRequirements• Minimum Bachelor's degree in Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative field • Excellent communication skills and ability to work both independently and with a geographically-dispersed team  • Understanding and interest in Financial Markets and Information Technology • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, detail oriented• Fluent in English (spoken and written) • Financial certifications, including CFA, FRM, and CAIA, are pluses • Experience with SQL, Python or other object-oriented programming language, VBA, UNIX/LINUX very beneficial, but not essential • Experience with financial software (e.g. Bloomberg, Eikon, FactSet) and financial databases are plusesBenefitsCompensation:• Competitive salary• Full benefits package• Performance-based annual bonusQontigo is an equal opportunity employer that offers challenging work in a supportive environment.Direct hires only - no agencies or recruiters

title: Data Analyst
description: Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de una persona para que se sume como Data Analyst a nuestro equipo de Data de Reba, para que pueda responder preguntas y problemáticas de negocio, realizando modelado de datos y aplicando métodos estadísticos.Entre sus principales funciones se destacan📌 Modelar problemáticas utilizando métodos estadísticos y de machine learning para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer oportunidades de mejora de negocio.📌 Colaborar manteniendo la plataforma de BI para democratizar el acceso a la información.📌 Dar soporte hacia la gerencia y los equipos de producto generando extrayendo información que les permitan tomar decisiones basadas en datos.RequisitosTítulo de grado en carreras de Facultades de Ciencias Exactas, así como Actuario/Economía, Estadística, Sistemas, Ingeniería o afines.Contar con experiencia analizando datos e implementando soluciones aplicando modelos de machine learning. Tener rigurosidad en el mantenimiento y curaduría de datosTener experiencia analizando y visualizando datos en Python y su stack cientïfico (Pandas/Numpy/Scikit-Learn/Jupyter/Matplotlib).Contar con experiencia trabajando con herramientas de control de versión (Git).Poseer conocimientos en bases de datos SQL.Tener experiencia utlizando herramientas de BI.Poseer habilidades de StoryTelling que permitan comunicar los resultados en forma clara y adaptándose a las posibles audiencias.Búsqueda laboral equitativa - Desde Reba sólo te pediremos la información estrictamente necesaria para el desempeño del trabajo que se ofrece. - Ley N°6471BeneficiosContamos con Importantes beneficios corporativos como una semana adicional de licencia, descuentos en gimnasios, clases de inglés in company, descuentos en distintos productos, convenios con prepagas, entre otros.No te olvides de incluir la remuneración bruta pretendida.Garantizamos absoluta confidencialidad y reserva.¡Sumate a Reba!¿Te imaginás siendo parte de la compañía que va a ayudar a miles de personas a vivir la vida que quieren?Reba es la app de servicios financieros que nació con el propósito de incluir a más personas al sistema financiero para que puedan construir el futuro que quieren. A través de una app simple e innovadora, miles de personas pueden tener acceso a los mejores servicios financieros con mayor simplicidad y transparencia.Reba es la App de Reba Compañía Financiera, una entidad Financiera Regulada por el BCRA. Al ser parte de Grupo Transatlántica, la compañía consigue el equilibrio ideal entre el respaldo y trayectoria de más de 50 años de vida en distintas industrias, junto a la innovación y flexibilidad que una compañía joven ofrece al mercado y sus colaboradores.Convencidos de que llegamos más lejos en equipo, buscamos incorporar a aquellos talentos que se sientan motivados por formar parte de un proyecto que va a generar impacto en la vida de miles de latinoamericanos. ¿Qué buscamos en esos talentos? El ADN Rebanker que sean cliente céntricos, que piensen a gran escala, y que trabajen con el más alto estándar de calidad, con respeto y buena onda.Sumate a esta aventura en la que tus ideas no sólo van a llevar tu carrera al próximo nivel, sino que también van a contribuir a cambiar la forma en la que miles de latinoamericanos se relacionan con sus finanzas. ¿Estás listo? ¡Nosotros, re!

title: Data Analyst
description: How we support the Whole You: Our benefits are a good reason to come to JLL.We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry, and then empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their health, financial and personal well-being. Our underlying benefits philosophy is this: be fair to our people and provide opportunities for those who take advantage of our programs and resources to increase their personal and financial security.Benefits to eligible employees, include:Health Insurance for you.Annual Performance Bonus.Online platform with certified courses for professional development.Discounts in several categories (Gym, academic institutions, among others).What this job involves We are looking for a Data Analyst – Data Management & Delivery who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Data Management team.This role requires partnering with the broader JLL team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data analysis and data management experience What is your day to day? Independently develops, executes, and monitors complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects.Develops proficiency in multiple data management disciplines and tools to develop robust data and information management solutions.Proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures.Monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives.Ensures proper escalation, prioritization, and remediation of data quality issues.Engages with colleagues and internal customers to reverse existing business processes and identify core business requirements for new information deliverables and data infrastructure.Consults with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of JLL data.Identifies and acquires new data sources, performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships, and develops prototype solutions to deliver immediate business value.This position involves updating the bases and global systems of all information and invoice processing.Collects and manages the necessary information to carry out the control panel: KPILeads the assembly of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) of the costumer, reconciling historical and projected information. Desired experience and technical skills Required 3 years of work experience in the fields of Information Science, data management and/or computer science or Economics.Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in Science, Business, or Social Science. Advanced degree preferred.Experience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or business intelligence deployed in a complex environment.Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyses data to develop actionable business information deliverables.Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently.Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment.Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages.Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing.Excellent technical, analytical, and organizational skills. Preferred SQL skills. Knowledge of ETL and statistical tools such as Informatica, SSIS and other data science tools such as Python, R, Tableau are desirable Location: Microcentro, Buenos Aires About JLL –We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities. Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do, and we’re honoured to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally. Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued, and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation, and succeed together.

description: GDN AR es una empresa de Retail, con más de 9000 colaboradores a nivel local y 92 tiendas distribuidas en todo el país. Como compañía buscamos ofrecer no solo la mejor calidad de productos al mejor precio, sino también una experiencia cercana y localmente relevante. title: Data Analyst
description: How we support the Whole You: Our benefits are a good reason to come to JLL.We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry, and then empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their health, financial and personal well-being. Our underlying benefits philosophy is this: be fair to our people and provide opportunities for those who take advantage of our programs and resources to increase their personal and financial security.Benefits to eligible employees, include:Health Insurance for you.Annual Performance Bonus.Online platform with certified courses for professional development.Discounts in several categories (Gym, academic institutions, among others).What this job involves We are looking for a Data Analyst – Data Management & Delivery who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Data Management team.This role requires partnering with the broader JLL team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data analysis and data management experience What is your day to day? Independently develops, executes, and monitors complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects.Develops proficiency in multiple data management disciplines and tools to develop robust data and information management solutions.Proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures.Monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives.Ensures proper escalation, prioritization, and remediation of data quality issues.Engages with colleagues and internal customers to reverse existing business processes and identify core business requirements for new information deliverables and data infrastructure.Consults with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of JLL data.Identifies and acquires new data sources, performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships, and develops prototype solutions to deliver immediate business value.This position involves updating the bases and global systems of all information and invoice processing.Collects and manages the necessary information to carry out the control panel: KPILeads the assembly of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) of the costumer, reconciling historical and projected information. Desired experience and technical skills Required 3 years of work experience in the fields of Information Science, data management and/or computer science or Economics.Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in Science, Business, or Social Science. Advanced degree preferred.Experience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or business intelligence deployed in a complex environment.Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyses data to develop actionable business information deliverables.Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently.Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment.Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages.Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing.Excellent technical, analytical, and organizational skills. Preferred SQL skills. Knowledge of ETL and statistical tools such as Informatica, SSIS and other data science tools such as Python, R, Tableau are desirable Location: Microcentro, Buenos Aires About JLL –We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities. Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do, and we’re honoured to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally. Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued, and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation, and succeed together.

title: Data Analytics - Analyst
description: Client Onboarding Data Analytics - Analyst The Client Onboarding MIS & Strategy team is seeking a new member to join its team based in Buenos Aires. The area's main responsibility is to produce periodic and Ad hoc reports, develop metrics, run controls and identify opportunities for automation in order to support global Client Onboarding activities.Responsibilities Include Prepare periodic and Ad hoc reports to support global Client Onboarding activities and participate in special projects as requested.  Participate in the design and development of dashboards that lead to data-driven decisions.  Identify opportunities to automate current processes and reports.  Work with internal partners and report to managers in a global team environment.  In-depth knowledge of procedures and systems to ensure client records are compliant with all applicable rules, with focus on process improvements.  Ad-Hoc requests from Senior Management.  Precisely share the information with the right audience and understand the incoming needs and anticipate data requirements. Qualifications Include University degree. (Engineering, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Economy, Business Administration or equivalent).  Fluent in English is mandatory, both written and verbally. Other languages are a plus.  Strong data visualization skills.  Knowledge of MS Excel and Office suit.  Be flexible, adaptable and eager to learn.  Ability to work maintaining attention to detail and applying best practices.  Work independently with self-prioritization and attention to deadlines.  Ability to engineer and enhance operational processes.  Strong control mindset. Desired Skills And Experience Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills  Highly organized, proactive and motivated with strong prioritization skills, innovation and problem-solving skills, and a control mindset, with the ability to deliver value-added support to business partners and clients in a timely and accurate manner.  Knowledge of any programming language is a plus (SQL, R, Python,) as well as experience with automation tools such as Alteryx and visual analytics platforms such as Tableau, or Power BI.  Sense of urgency/ability to work well under pressure and tight deadlines.  Demonstrates flexibility and willingness to accept new assignments and challenges in a rapidly changing environment, as well as handling multiple tasks and changing priorities on a daily basis. If you join the company, you will be part of a diverse and inclusive team that supports each other and will empower you to do your best work.BenefitsBelow you´ll find some examples of ongoing initiatives to promote it and a link to learn more about our benefits & cultureYour wellbeing is very important to us. Home office/ flexible work arrangements and work tools to ensure a great experience.  Generous vacation, exam and parental leave.  Support for parents, including Family Network that provides support to parents and caregivers, Lactation room on premise, and Paid Day care for your children up to 6-years-old .  Medical coverage for you and your family, including domestic partners.  Employee Assistance Program which provides personal and confidential advisory on psychological, financial and legal matters.  Wellness programs - e.g. Yoga, stretching and mindfulness classes delivered on premises.  Language classes, mentorship programs and customized trainings.  Platform for employee discounts in Buenos Aires. More info can be found here: https://careers.jpmorgan.com/global/en/about-usJ.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

En esta oportunidad, buscanos un profesional enfocado en relevar y entender necesidades informacionales del negocio, desarrollando soluciones de datos para impulsar un proceso de decisión basado en insights.Tus principales funciones serán Transformar diferentes fuentes de datos en información accionable, expuesta en productos de datos. Llevar adelante análisis exploratorios que permitan generar nuevas hipótesis e identificar oportunidades de mejora dentro del producto y de la información. Lograr entendimiento clave de los objetivos de negocio y la forma en que la compañía opera para poder entregar productos de valor.RequisitosEstudiante avanzado o graduado de las carreras de Informática, Sistemas, Ingeniería, Ciencias Económicas, Actuario o MarketingExperiencia de al menos 2 años en proyectos de analisis y visualización de datos.Experiencia en proyectos de Business Intelligence y herramientas Data Visualization; analisis funcional y documentación; analisis de datos numeros, kpis, evolutivos, informes de gestion, conceptos basicos comercialesSi tenés experiencia en el rubro financiero/de seguros y en Tableau será un plus!¿Qué más esperamos de vos? Proactividad, orientación al servicio y foco en el cliente Autonomía Fuertes habilidades de comunicación y relacionamiento para establecer vínculos sólidos y eficientes con el resto de la organización, en todos sus niveles Capacidad de análisis e interpretación de datos, orientación numérica ¡Curiosidad y ganas de aprender e innovar!Beneficios😉 Gran clima de trabajo🎓 Capacitación continua🌎 Oportunidades de desarrollo global*✅ Importantes descuentos en seguros para vos y referidos🥳 Día del cumpleaños libre🏠 Día de mudanza!💰 Premio aniversario compañía🏖️ 17 días vacaciones, se activan en enero y las tomás como quieras!💻 Trabajo híbrido🍴 Comedor económico para tus desayunos y almuerzos🚲 Vení en Bici! Tenemos vestuarios y guardería🧘🏽‍♂‍ Actividades de bienestar👶🏼 Paternidad extendida📚 Kit Nacimiento y beneficio de ayuda escolar anual🍼 Plus por guardería y colonia extendido y muchos +La Caja hoy es parte de Generali Group líder global en seguros, presente en 50 países en el mundo, con más de 72 mil empleados sirviendo a 65.9 millones de clientes.♻️ *La Caja es una empresa con fuerte compromiso social -THSN es nuestro programa de voluntariado corporativo, una iniciativa global de Generali Group que tiene como objetivo desbloquear el potencial de las personas en situación de vulnerabilidad alrededor del mundo y mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajamos junto con las ONGs Haciendo Camino y Fundación Emmanuel, brindando herramientas a padres y madres de niños/as de 0 a 6 años. A través de talleres de crianza positiva, nutrición y oficios alcanzando a 600 familias por año de las comunidades de La Plata y Santiago del Estero.Con más de 1900 empleados y 61 sucursales en todo el país, La Caja mantiene su posición de liderazgo en el mercado asegurador argentino general con una cuota total del 4,59% y del 10,13% en el rubro automotor (según la Superintendencia de Seguros de la Nación a septiembre de 2020). En su búsqueda por ofrecer un servicio de excelencia, se destaca por su variada oferta de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de los consumidores de la forma más simple. Lleva adelante una estrategia omnicanal, con foco en tecnología e innovación, para ser socio de por vida de sus clientes. La Caja es parte del Grupo italiano Generali, que tiene fuerte presencia en el mercado del seguro a nivel internacional, y representa la mayor participación del Grupo en Latinoamérica.

title: Financial Market Data Analyst
description: Does working for a company that embodies innovation, transparency and creativity excite you? Then, we have the place for you.Bringing together Axioma, DAX and STOXX to form Qontigo represents a partnership beyond standard, creating an investment intelligence advantage with our clients, from risk to return. Qontigo combines the most sophisticated risk analytics and portfolio-construction tools in the market with globally recognized leadership in creating market-defining indices.We Innovate. We Create. We Collaborate.Qontigo is currently seeking a qualified professional to join our Market Data Services team as a full-time employee, based in our Buenos Aires office. In this role, the analyst will produce high quality value-added content, by working closely with the Development, Research, Index, and Client Support business units. The output of the analyst's work will consist of producing a suite of daily-updated multi-factor risk models, quantitative indices, and multi-asset class data analytics. The successful candidate will provide ongoing operational support for best-in-class index products to global sell-side, buy-side, hedge funds, and asset owner investors. The candidate will use quantitative and qualitative skills to manage the ongoing maintenance of index and data products, which include operational processes, data analysis, data reconciliation, and quality assurance.Please submit your resume/CV in English.To note that this position intends to have a monthly late shift rotation covering the Pacific Time (PST) business hours that translates to a Monday-Friday working schedule of 1pm-10pm and 2pm - 11pm Argentina time (dependent on daylight savings time) one week per month. The remaining weeks of the month this position will work regular Argentina business hours. ResponsibilitiesPerform Quality Assurance tasks and data analysis to ensure validity of content produced and delivered to Qontigo's clients, for both the analytics and indexing business lines • Provide ongoing support and maintenance for various index products with time-sensitive deadlines • Monitor financial markets and ensure the correct processing of corporate events, such as IPOs, M&As, stock splits, rights issues, and dividend distributions• Help with data ingestion activities and in data reconciliation tasks about identifiers and other instrument attributes • Work closely with other team members based in the London, Hong Kong, and New York offices of Qontigo • Manipulate large amount of financial data and use various tools to present and analyze results • Assist the Sales and Client Support teams in resolving data inquiries • Proactively look for opportunities to streamline processes wherever appropriate • Collaborate and communicate across all teams involved with index and data production processRequirements• Minimum Bachelor's degree in Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative field • Excellent communication skills and ability to work both independently and with a geographically-dispersed team  • Understanding and interest in Financial Markets and Information Technology • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, detail oriented• Fluent in English (spoken and written) • Financial certifications, including CFA, FRM, and CAIA, are pluses • Experience with SQL, Python or other object-oriented programming language, VBA, UNIX/LINUX very beneficial, but not essential • Experience with financial software (e.g. Bloomberg, Eikon, FactSet) and financial databases are plusesBenefitsCompensation:• Competitive salary• Full benefits package• Performance-based annual bonusQontigo is an equal opportunity employer that offers challenging work in a supportive environment.Direct hires only - no agencies or recruiters

title: Data Analyst
description: Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de una persona para que se sume como Data Analyst a nuestro equipo de Data de Reba, para que pueda responder preguntas y problemáticas de negocio, realizando modelado de datos y aplicando métodos estadísticos.Entre sus principales funciones se destacan📌 Modelar problemáticas utilizando métodos estadísticos y de machine learning para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer oportunidades de mejora de negocio.📌 Colaborar manteniendo la plataforma de BI para democratizar el acceso a la información.📌 Dar soporte hacia la gerencia y los equipos de producto generando extrayendo información que les permitan tomar decisiones basadas en datos.RequisitosTítulo de grado en carreras de Facultades de Ciencias Exactas, así como Actuario/Economía, Estadística, Sistemas, Ingeniería o afines.Contar con experiencia analizando datos e implementando soluciones aplicando modelos de machine learning. Tener rigurosidad en el mantenimiento y curaduría de datosTener experiencia analizando y visualizando datos en Python y su stack cientïfico (Pandas/Numpy/Scikit-Learn/Jupyter/Matplotlib).Contar con experiencia trabajando con herramientas de control de versión (Git).Poseer conocimientos en bases de datos SQL.Tener experiencia utlizando herramientas de BI.Poseer habilidades de StoryTelling que permitan comunicar los resultados en forma clara y adaptándose a las posibles audiencias.Búsqueda laboral equitativa - Desde Reba sólo te pediremos la información estrictamente necesaria para el desempeño del trabajo que se ofrece. - Ley N°6471BeneficiosContamos con Importantes beneficios corporativos como una semana adicional de licencia, descuentos en gimnasios, clases de inglés in company, descuentos en distintos productos, convenios con prepagas, entre otros.No te olvides de incluir la remuneración bruta pretendida.Garantizamos absoluta confidencialidad y reserva.¡Sumate a Reba!¿Te imaginás siendo parte de la compañía que va a ayudar a miles de personas a vivir la vida que quieren?Reba es la app de servicios financieros que nació con el propósito de incluir a más personas al sistema financiero para que puedan construir el futuro que quieren. A través de una app simple e innovadora, miles de personas pueden tener acceso a los mejores servicios financieros con mayor simplicidad y transparencia.Reba es la App de Reba Compañía Financiera, una entidad Financiera Regulada por el BCRA. Al ser parte de Grupo Transatlántica, la compañía consigue el equilibrio ideal entre el respaldo y trayectoria de más de 50 años de vida en distintas industrias, junto a la innovación y flexibilidad que una compañía joven ofrece al mercado y sus colaboradores.Convencidos de que llegamos más lejos en equipo, buscamos incorporar a aquellos talentos que se sientan motivados por formar parte de un proyecto que va a generar impacto en la vida de miles de latinoamericanos. ¿Qué buscamos en esos talentos? El ADN Rebanker que sean cliente céntricos, que piensen a gran escala, y que trabajen con el más alto estándar de calidad, con respeto y buena onda.Sumate a esta aventura en la que tus ideas no sólo van a llevar tu carrera al próximo nivel, sino que también van a contribuir a cambiar la forma en la que miles de latinoamericanos se relacionan con sus finanzas. ¿Estás listo? ¡Nosotros, re!

title: Data Analyst
description: How we support the Whole You: Our benefits are a good reason to come to JLL.We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry, and then empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their health, financial and personal well-being. Our underlying benefits philosophy is this: be fair to our people and provide opportunities for those who take advantage of our programs and resources to increase their personal and financial security.Benefits to eligible employees, include:Health Insurance for you.Annual Performance Bonus.Online platform with certified courses for professional development.Discounts in several categories (Gym, academic institutions, among others).What this job involves We are looking for a Data Analyst – Data Management & Delivery who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Data Management team.This role requires partnering with the broader JLL team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data analysis and data management experience What is your day to day? Independently develops, executes, and monitors complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects.Develops proficiency in multiple data management disciplines and tools to develop robust data and information management solutions.Proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures.Monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives.Ensures proper escalation, prioritization, and remediation of data quality issues.Engages with colleagues and internal customers to reverse existing business processes and identify core business requirements for new information deliverables and data infrastructure.Consults with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of JLL data.Identifies and acquires new data sources, performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships, and develops prototype solutions to deliver immediate business value.This position involves updating the bases and global systems of all information and invoice processing.Collects and manages the necessary information to carry out the control panel: KPILeads the assembly of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) of the costumer, reconciling historical and projected information. Desired experience and technical skills Required 3 years of work experience in the fields of Information Science, data management and/or computer science or Economics.Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in Science, Business, or Social Science. Advanced degree preferred.Experience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or business intelligence deployed in a complex environment.Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyses data to develop actionable business information deliverables.Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently.Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment.Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages.Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing.Excellent technical, analytical, and organizational skills. Preferred SQL skills. Knowledge of ETL and statistical tools such as Informatica, SSIS and other data science tools such as Python, R, Tableau are desirable Location: Microcentro, Buenos Aires About JLL –We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities. Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do, and we’re honoured to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally. Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued, and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation, and succeed together.
